description: Carlisle 8MXT-4480-21 Panther XT Synchronous Belt
additional_description:
PowerMiser™ is a powerful, but simple web based application for desktop and mobile use that identifies estimated annual energy costs, savings and payback that can be realized by upgrading to Carlisle belts by Timken.

Open PowerMiser

Reduce Downtime and Save

With the energy efficient Gold-Ribbon, Power-Wedge, Super II, and Durapower II v-belts or Panther and Panther XT synchronous belts, you’ll gain improved system wide performance. Although initial cost may be slightly higher than ordinary belts, payback is significant - and begins immediately! Use PowerMiser to calculate the savings. For superior performance and energy savings you can count on Carlisle belts by Timken.

NOTE: PowerMiser is a free web application and is not available from the App store.

description: Carlisle DP101MS Super Blue Ribbon V-Belt
additional_description:
The finest wrapped belt in the industry and workhorse of classical V-belts. Super Blue Ribbon v-belts assure dependable length stability and require less re-tensioning and take-up. The cord is coated with a special compound that produces a secure, long-lasting bond with the surrounding rubber. The heavy-duty fabric cover protects the core. Its extra flexibility permits the belt to bend more easily around the smallest pulleys with less strain on the fabric. Longer belt life results in less frequent replacement, less downtime and lower maintenance costs.

Features/Advantages

  • Dependable performance on classical belt drives
  • Heavy duty cover is impregnated with oil and heat resistant rubber
  • Resists flex fatigue
  • Longer belt life
  • Smoother running
  • Backed by our Iron Clad Guarantee
  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Mixers, pumps, conveyors, any and everything, and more

Sizes

  • AP, BP, CP, DP, EP cross-sections from 22" to 664"

description: Carlisle 5V1600MS Super Power-Wedge V-Belt
additional_description:
Wedge-Band is the banded version of the hard-working Super Power-Wedge v-belt. Wedge-Band is an excellent choice for virtually any application where increased horsepower capacity and output is needed, or where conventional multiple belt drives are impractical because of space or weight limitations. The specially compounded wrapped construction is ideal for clutching operations. Banded v-belts are ideally suited for pulsating or heavily shock loaded drives and drives with extremely long center distances. Wedge-Band is oil and heat resistant, static dissipating, and it won’t turn over or jump off the drive.

Features/Advantages

  • Prevents belt whip and rollover on long center distance drives

  • Smoother clutching

  • Space and weight saver

  • Oversized polyester cord provides added belt strength and stability

  • Cord is chemically treated for resistance to belt stretch

  • Tie-band is highly engineered to permanently bond multiple belts together enabling the belts to function as a single unit with even load distribution and wear

  • Vibration is dampened

  • Heavy shock loads are absorbed

Applications

  • Mud pumps, rock crushers, stump grinders, and more

Sizes

  • R3V, R5V and R8V cross-sections from 34" to 601"

description: Carlisle B124MS Super II V-Belt
additional_description:
The Problem Solver! Super II v-belts are the solution to the constant and costly problem of replacing ordinary v-belts on troublesome drives. Specially formulated fiber-loaded EPDM rubber compounds, engineered fabrics and high-modulus polyester cord offer greater strength, longer life, better heat dissipation and higher efficiencies than best-in-class wrapped v-belts. The unique CNA (central neutral axis) cord placement positions the strength of the belt lower on the pulleys to maintain stability and prevent roll-over. The raw edge construction results in more efficient power transmission and reduced energy loss.

Features/Advantages

  • Higher performance alternative to classical wrapped v-belts
  • More energy efficient than wrapped v-belts
  • Unique design for longer life
  • Less maintenance and downtime
  • EPDM rubber compound is static conductive, resistant to hardening and glazing, and operates in a broad temperature range (-50ºF to +250ºF)
  • Backed by our Iron Clad Guarantee
  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Shaker screens, debarkers, industrial washers and dryers, and more

Sizes

  • A, B and C cross-sections from 17" to 144"

description: Carlisle 916R111 Round Belts
additional_description:
Round belts are a high performance solution for conveyors, quarter-turn, twisted, and serpentine drives. Our round belts feature a no-splice construction for added durability with minimal stretch for minimum take-up requirements.

Features/Advantages

  • Heavy duty stress-relieved fabric cover flexes better for improved belt life

  • Hi-modulus cords carry horsepower loads with minimum stretch

  • Better belt stability and fewer take-up adjustments

  • Compression section provides uniform cord support and improves belt flex life

  • No splice for added durability.

Applications

  • Conveyors, commercial sewing machines, quarter-turn drives, twisted drives, serpentine drives and more

Sizes

  • 7/16" and 9/16" diameters from 70" to 762"

description: Carlisle CC330S Dry Can Belts
additional_description:
The original deep-groove notched design is specifically developed for double angle “CC” drives commonly found in the demanding textile industry. The deep groove prevents belt rollover while the notches provide added flexibility and longer life.

Features/Advantages

  • Multiple ply fabric cord provides superior strength and durability

  • Strong yet flexible for power transmission from both sides of the belt

  • Resistant to oil and heat

  • Static conductive

Applications

  • Drives with long center, serpentine applications usually found in the textile industry

NOTE: Dry Can belts are normally used as a single belt on a drive and matching is not required. When ordering two or more Dry Can belts to be used as a matched set on the same drive, please specify that the belts must be a matched set.

Sizes

  • Cross-section from 212" to 902"

description: Carlisle 3226V663 Variable Speed
additional_description:
Timken Belts is a leader in variable speed belt technology. For use with industrial variable speed pulleys to gain a wide range of driven speeds. Raw edge sidewalls improve gripping action. Unitized belt bonding and specially formulated rubber compounds provide superior resistance to aging caused by wear, oil, heat, and harmful environmental factors. The Variable Speed Cog-Belt has been engineered to the same high standards that Timken Belts uses to produce belts for original equipment manufacturers (OEMs).

Features/Advantages

  • Smooth running

  • Oil and heat resistant

  • Long belt life

  • Wide selection of sizes

  • Static dissipating

Applications

  • Industrial variable speed drives

  • For snowmobile and ATV variable speed belts click here

Sizes

  • A wide selection of cross sections, top widths and lengths

description: Carlisle 5VX800MS Power-Wedge Cog-Belt
additional_description:
More Grip. Less Slip. The Metric Power-Wedge Cog-Belt combines the advantages of the narrow wedge design with raw edge performance for maximum operating efficiency in a compact drive package. The narrow profile permits reduced drive widths and a smaller drive envelope. Higher horsepower ratings translate into greater design flexibility — reducing drive cost, space and weight.

The Power-Wedge Cog-Belt is now made of EPDM (Ethylene Propylene Diene Monomer), a synthetic rubber with outstanding properties. The raw-edge construction contributes to outstanding operating efficiency. More torque with little or no slippage. The result is savings — in time, in belt life and in energy costs.

Features/Advantages

  • High horsepower ratings

  • Design flexibility

  • Longer belt life

  • Durable                                                                         

  • Oil and heat resistant

  • Static conductive

  • Resists hardening and glazing

  • Broad operating temperature range (-50°F to +250°F)

  • Smoother running

  • Energy efficient

  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Drives that require metric cross sections on industrial machinery, fans, pumps, and more

Sizes

  • Available in SPZX, SPAX, SPBX, and SPCX cross sections from 643mm to 5092mm. Also available in 3VX, 5VX, and 8VX imperial sizes. Where applicable, belts are dual branded with imperial and metric part numbers.

description: Carlisle BP116MS Super Blue Ribbon V-Belt
additional_description:
The finest wrapped belt in the industry and workhorse of classical V-belts. Super Blue Ribbon v-belts assure dependable length stability and require less re-tensioning and take-up. The cord is coated with a special compound that produces a secure, long-lasting bond with the surrounding rubber. The heavy-duty fabric cover protects the core. Its extra flexibility permits the belt to bend more easily around the smallest pulleys with less strain on the fabric. Longer belt life results in less frequent replacement, less downtime and lower maintenance costs.

Features/Advantages

  • Dependable performance on classical belt drives
  • Heavy duty cover is impregnated with oil and heat resistant rubber
  • Resists flex fatigue
  • Longer belt life
  • Smoother running
  • Backed by our Iron Clad Guarantee
  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Mixers, pumps, conveyors, any and everything, and more

Sizes

  • AP, BP, CP, DP, EP cross-sections from 22" to 664"

description: Carlisle 8MXT-2400-36 Panther XT Synchronous Belt
additional_description:
PowerMiser™ is a powerful, but simple web based application for desktop and mobile use that identifies estimated annual energy costs, savings and payback that can be realized by upgrading to Carlisle belts by Timken.

Open PowerMiser

Reduce Downtime and Save

With the energy efficient Gold-Ribbon, Power-Wedge, Super II, and Durapower II v-belts or Panther and Panther XT synchronous belts, you’ll gain improved system wide performance. Although initial cost may be slightly higher than ordinary belts, payback is significant - and begins immediately! Use PowerMiser to calculate the savings. For superior performance and energy savings you can count on Carlisle belts by Timken.

NOTE: PowerMiser is a free web application and is not available from the App store.

description: Carlisle B112 Super Ii V-Belt
additional_description:
The Problem Solver! Super II v-belts are the solution to the constant and costly problem of replacing ordinary v-belts on troublesome drives. Specially formulated fiber-loaded EPDM rubber compounds, engineered fabrics and high-modulus polyester cord offer greater strength, longer life, better heat dissipation and higher efficiencies than best-in-class wrapped v-belts. The unique CNA (central neutral axis) cord placement positions the strength of the belt lower on the pulleys to maintain stability and prevent roll-over. The raw edge construction results in more efficient power transmission and reduced energy loss.

Features/Advantages

  • Higher performance alternative to classical wrapped v-belts
  • More energy efficient than wrapped v-belts
  • Unique design for longer life
  • Less maintenance and downtime
  • EPDM rubber compound is static conductive, resistant to hardening and glazing, and operates in a broad temperature range (-50ºF to +250ºF)
  • Backed by our Iron Clad Guarantee
  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Shaker screens, debarkers, industrial washers and dryers, and more

Sizes

  • A, B and C cross-sections from 17" to 144"

description: Carlisle 1922V277 Variable Speed
additional_description:
Timken Belts is a leader in variable speed belt technology. For use with industrial variable speed pulleys to gain a wide range of driven speeds. Raw edge sidewalls improve gripping action. Unitized belt bonding and specially formulated rubber compounds provide superior resistance to aging caused by wear, oil, heat, and harmful environmental factors. The Variable Speed Cog-Belt has been engineered to the same high standards that Timken Belts uses to produce belts for original equipment manufacturers (OEMs).

Features/Advantages

  • Smooth running

  • Oil and heat resistant

  • Long belt life

  • Wide selection of sizes

  • Static dissipating

Applications

  • Industrial variable speed drives

  • For snowmobile and ATV variable speed belts click here

Sizes

  • A wide selection of cross sections, top widths and lengths

description: Carlisle SPBX2650MS Power-Wedge Cog-Belt
additional_description:
More Grip. Less Slip. The Metric Power-Wedge Cog-Belt combines the advantages of the narrow wedge design with raw edge performance for maximum operating efficiency in a compact drive package. The narrow profile permits reduced drive widths and a smaller drive envelope. Higher horsepower ratings translate into greater design flexibility — reducing drive cost, space and weight.

The Power-Wedge Cog-Belt is now made of EPDM (Ethylene Propylene Diene Monomer), a synthetic rubber with outstanding properties. The raw-edge construction contributes to outstanding operating efficiency. More torque with little or no slippage. The result is savings — in time, in belt life and in energy costs.

Features/Advantages

  • High horsepower ratings

  • Design flexibility

  • Longer belt life

  • Durable                                                                         

  • Oil and heat resistant

  • Static conductive

  • Resists hardening and glazing

  • Broad operating temperature range (-50°F to +250°F)

  • Smoother running

  • Energy efficient

  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Drives that require metric cross sections on industrial machinery, fans, pumps, and more

Sizes

  • Available in SPZX, SPAX, SPBX, and SPCX cross sections from 643mm to 5092mm. Also available in 3VX, 5VX, and 8VX imperial sizes. Where applicable, belts are dual branded with imperial and metric part numbers.

description: Carlisle 716R75 Round Belts
additional_description:
Round belts are a high performance solution for conveyors, quarter-turn, twisted, and serpentine drives. Our round belts feature a no-splice construction for added durability with minimal stretch for minimum take-up requirements.

Features/Advantages

  • Heavy duty stress-relieved fabric cover flexes better for improved belt life

  • Hi-modulus cords carry horsepower loads with minimum stretch

  • Better belt stability and fewer take-up adjustments

  • Compression section provides uniform cord support and improves belt flex life

  • No splice for added durability.

Applications

  • Conveyors, commercial sewing machines, quarter-turn drives, twisted drives, serpentine drives and more

Sizes

  • 7/16" and 9/16" diameters from 70" to 762"

description: Carlisle 8V4000MS Super Power-Wedge V-Belt
additional_description:
Wedge-Band is the banded version of the hard-working Super Power-Wedge v-belt. Wedge-Band is an excellent choice for virtually any application where increased horsepower capacity and output is needed, or where conventional multiple belt drives are impractical because of space or weight limitations. The specially compounded wrapped construction is ideal for clutching operations. Banded v-belts are ideally suited for pulsating or heavily shock loaded drives and drives with extremely long center distances. Wedge-Band is oil and heat resistant, static dissipating, and it won’t turn over or jump off the drive.

Features/Advantages

  • Prevents belt whip and rollover on long center distance drives

  • Smoother clutching

  • Space and weight saver

  • Oversized polyester cord provides added belt strength and stability

  • Cord is chemically treated for resistance to belt stretch

  • Tie-band is highly engineered to permanently bond multiple belts together enabling the belts to function as a single unit with even load distribution and wear

  • Vibration is dampened

  • Heavy shock loads are absorbed

Applications

  • Mud pumps, rock crushers, stump grinders, and more

Sizes

  • R3V, R5V and R8V cross-sections from 34" to 601"

description: Carlisle 716R88 Round Belts
additional_description:
Round belts are a high performance solution for conveyors, quarter-turn, twisted, and serpentine drives. Our round belts feature a no-splice construction for added durability with minimal stretch for minimum take-up requirements.

Features/Advantages

  • Heavy duty stress-relieved fabric cover flexes better for improved belt life

  • Hi-modulus cords carry horsepower loads with minimum stretch

  • Better belt stability and fewer take-up adjustments

  • Compression section provides uniform cord support and improves belt flex life

  • No splice for added durability.

Applications

  • Conveyors, commercial sewing machines, quarter-turn drives, twisted drives, serpentine drives and more

Sizes

  • 7/16" and 9/16" diameters from 70" to 762"

description: Carlisle 14MXT-1400-37 Panther XT Synchronous Belt
additional_description:
PowerMiser™ is a powerful, but simple web based application for desktop and mobile use that identifies estimated annual energy costs, savings and payback that can be realized by upgrading to Carlisle belts by Timken.

Open PowerMiser

Reduce Downtime and Save

With the energy efficient Gold-Ribbon, Power-Wedge, Super II, and Durapower II v-belts or Panther and Panther XT synchronous belts, you’ll gain improved system wide performance. Although initial cost may be slightly higher than ordinary belts, payback is significant - and begins immediately! Use PowerMiser to calculate the savings. For superior performance and energy savings you can count on Carlisle belts by Timken.

NOTE: PowerMiser is a free web application and is not available from the App store.

description: Carlisle SPBX2120MS Power-Wedge Cog-Belt
additional_description:
More Grip. Less Slip. The Metric Power-Wedge Cog-Belt combines the advantages of the narrow wedge design with raw edge performance for maximum operating efficiency in a compact drive package. The narrow profile permits reduced drive widths and a smaller drive envelope. Higher horsepower ratings translate into greater design flexibility — reducing drive cost, space and weight.

The Power-Wedge Cog-Belt is now made of EPDM (Ethylene Propylene Diene Monomer), a synthetic rubber with outstanding properties. The raw-edge construction contributes to outstanding operating efficiency. More torque with little or no slippage. The result is savings — in time, in belt life and in energy costs.

Features/Advantages

  • High horsepower ratings

  • Design flexibility

  • Longer belt life

  • Durable                                                                         

  • Oil and heat resistant

  • Static conductive

  • Resists hardening and glazing

  • Broad operating temperature range (-50°F to +250°F)

  • Smoother running

  • Energy efficient

  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Drives that require metric cross sections on industrial machinery, fans, pumps, and more

Sizes

  • Available in SPZX, SPAX, SPBX, and SPCX cross sections from 643mm to 5092mm. Also available in 3VX, 5VX, and 8VX imperial sizes. Where applicable, belts are dual branded with imperial and metric part numbers.

The unique CNA (central neutral axis) cord placement positions the strength of the belt lower on the pulleys to maintain stability and prevent roll-over. The raw edge construction results in more efficient power transmission and reduced energy loss.

Features/Advantages

  • Higher performance alternative to classical wrapped v-belts
  • More energy efficient than wrapped v-belts
  • Unique design for longer life
  • Less maintenance and downtime
  • EPDM rubber compound is static conductive, resistant to hardening and glazing, and operates in a broad temperature range (-50ºF to +250ºF)
  • Backed by our Iron Clad Guarantee
  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Shaker screens, debarkers, industrial washers and dryers, and more

Sizes

  • A, B and C cross-sections from 17" to 144"

description: Carlisle 14MXT-3304-125 Panther XT Synchronous Belt

For superior performance and energy savings you can count on Carlisle belts by Timken.

description: Carlisle SPAX2180MS Power-Wedge Cog-Belt
additional_description:
More Grip. Less Slip. The Metric Power-Wedge Cog-Belt combines the advantages of the narrow wedge design with raw edge performance for maximum operating efficiency in a compact drive package. The narrow profile permits reduced drive widths and a smaller drive envelope. Higher horsepower ratings translate into greater design flexibility — reducing drive cost, space and weight.

The Power-Wedge Cog-Belt is now made of EPDM (Ethylene Propylene Diene Monomer), a synthetic rubber with outstanding properties. The raw-edge construction contributes to outstanding operating efficiency. More torque with little or no slippage. The result is savings — in time, in belt life and in energy costs.

Features/Advantages

  • High horsepower ratings

  • Design flexibility

  • Longer belt life

  • Durable                                                                         

  • Oil and heat resistant

  • Static conductive

  • Resists hardening and glazing

  • Broad operating temperature range (-50°F to +250°F)

  • Smoother running

  • Energy efficient

  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Drives that require metric cross sections on industrial machinery, fans, pumps, and more

Sizes

  • Available in SPZX, SPAX, SPBX, and SPCX cross sections from 643mm to 5092mm. Also available in 3VX, 5VX, and 8VX imperial sizes. Where applicable, belts are dual branded with imperial and metric part numbers.

description: Carlisle CC600S Dry Can Belt
additional_description:
The original deep-groove notched design is specifically developed for double angle “CC” drives commonly found in the demanding textile industry. The deep groove prevents belt rollover while the notches provide added flexibility and longer life.

Features/Advantages

  • Multiple ply fabric cord provides superior strength and durability

  • Strong yet flexible for power transmission from both sides of the belt

  • Resistant to oil and heat

  • Static conductive

Applications

  • Drives with long center, serpentine applications usually found in the textile industry

NOTE: Dry Can belts are normally used as a single belt on a drive and matching is not required. When ordering two or more Dry Can belts to be used as a matched set on the same drive, please specify that the belts must be a matched set.

Sizes

  • Cross-section from 212" to 902"

description: Carlisle CP160MS Super Blue Ribbon V-Belt
additional_description:
The finest wrapped belt in the industry and workhorse of classical V-belts. Super Blue Ribbon v-belts assure dependable length stability and require less re-tensioning and take-up. The cord is coated with a special compound that produces a secure, long-lasting bond with the surrounding rubber. The heavy-duty fabric cover protects the core. Its extra flexibility permits the belt to bend more easily around the smallest pulleys with less strain on the fabric. Longer belt life results in less frequent replacement, less downtime and lower maintenance costs.

Features/Advantages

  • Dependable performance on classical belt drives
  • Heavy duty cover is impregnated with oil and heat resistant rubber
  • Resists flex fatigue
  • Longer belt life
  • Smoother running
  • Backed by our Iron Clad Guarantee
  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Mixers, pumps, conveyors, any and everything, and more

Sizes

  • AP, BP, CP, DP, EP cross-sections from 22" to 664"

description: Carlisle 1650M16 V-Ribbed
additional_description:
Vee-Rib belts are ideally suited for high speed drives where conventional v-belts cannot operate. The Vee-Rib belt provides smooth, vibration-free performance in a compact drive. The special “truncated” rib design enhances belt flexibility and resists cracking better than non-truncated v-ribbed belts. Vee-Rib is resistant to oil, heat and abrasion for longer belt life.

Features/Advantages

  • Vibration-free

  • Heat resistant

  • Maximum flexibility

  • High horsepower

  • Abrasion resistant

Applications

  • Industrial dryers, fitness equipment, machine tools, high speed blowers, and more

Sizes

  • J cross-section from 13" to 98"

description: Carlisle 5V710MS Super Power-Wedge V-Belt
additional_description:
Wedge-Band is the banded version of the hard-working Super Power-Wedge v-belt. Wedge-Band is an excellent choice for virtually any application where increased horsepower capacity and output is needed, or where conventional multiple belt drives are impractical because of space or weight limitations. The specially compounded wrapped construction is ideal for clutching operations. Banded v-belts are ideally suited for pulsating or heavily shock loaded drives and drives with extremely long center distances. Wedge-Band is oil and heat resistant, static dissipating, and it won’t turn over or jump off the drive.

Features/Advantages

  • Prevents belt whip and rollover on long center distance drives

  • Smoother clutching

  • Space and weight saver

  • Oversized polyester cord provides added belt strength and stability

  • Cord is chemically treated for resistance to belt stretch

  • Tie-band is highly engineered to permanently bond multiple belts together enabling the belts to function as a single unit with even load distribution and wear

  • Vibration is dampened

  • Heavy shock loads are absorbed

Applications

  • Mud pumps, rock crushers, stump grinders, and more

Sizes

  • R3V, R5V and R8V cross-sections from 34" to 601"

description: Carlisle AP76MS Super Blue Ribbon V-Belt
additional_description:
The finest wrapped belt in the industry and workhorse of classical V-belts. Super Blue Ribbon v-belts assure dependable length stability and require less re-tensioning and take-up. The cord is coated with a special compound that produces a secure, long-lasting bond with the surrounding rubber. The heavy-duty fabric cover protects the core. Its extra flexibility permits the belt to bend more easily around the smallest pulleys with less strain on the fabric. Longer belt life results in less frequent replacement, less downtime and lower maintenance costs.

Features/Advantages

  • Dependable performance on classical belt drives
  • Heavy duty cover is impregnated with oil and heat resistant rubber
  • Resists flex fatigue
  • Longer belt life
  • Smoother running
  • Backed by our Iron Clad Guarantee
  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Mixers, pumps, conveyors, any and everything, and more

Sizes

  • AP, BP, CP, DP, EP cross-sections from 22" to 664"

description: Carlisle B67MS Super II V-Belt
additional_description:
The Problem Solver! Super II v-belts are the solution to the constant and costly problem of replacing ordinary v-belts on troublesome drives. Specially formulated fiber-loaded EPDM rubber compounds, engineered fabrics and high-modulus polyester cord offer greater strength, longer life, better heat dissipation and higher efficiencies than best-in-class wrapped v-belts. The unique CNA (central neutral axis) cord placement positions the strength of the belt lower on the pulleys to maintain stability and prevent roll-over. The raw edge construction results in more efficient power transmission and reduced energy loss.

Features/Advantages

  • Higher performance alternative to classical wrapped v-belts
  • More energy efficient than wrapped v-belts
  • Unique design for longer life
  • Less maintenance and downtime
  • EPDM rubber compound is static conductive, resistant to hardening and glazing, and operates in a broad temperature range (-50ºF to +250ºF)
  • Backed by our Iron Clad Guarantee
  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Shaker screens, debarkers, industrial washers and dryers, and more

Sizes

  • A, B and C cross-sections from 17" to 144"

Although initial cost may be slightly higher than ordinary belts, payback is significant - and begins immediately! Use PowerMiser to calculate the savings. description: Carlisle RBP138-4 Super Vee-Band Belt
additional_description:
The Super Vee-Band belt is an ideal choice on classical drives where individual v-belts tend to roll over or whip severely on the drive due to fluctuating load conditions or harsh drive vibration. The individual ribs are permanently joined together at the top with a reinforced fabric tie-band preventing the individual belts from coming off the drive.

Features/Advantages

  • Prevents belt whip and rollover on long center distance drives

  • Tie-Band is highly engineered to permanently bond multiple belts together enabling the belts to function as a single unit with even load distribution and wear

  • Excellent oil and heat resistance, static dissipating

  • Vibration is dampened

  • Heavy shock loads are absorbed

Applications

  • Rock crushers, vibrating equipment, saws, pumps, and more

Sizes

  • RBP, RCP and RDP cross-sections from 39" to 663"

description: Carlisle 1930V600 Variable Speed
additional_description:
Timken Belts is a leader in variable speed belt technology. For use with industrial variable speed pulleys to gain a wide range of driven speeds. Raw edge sidewalls improve gripping action. Unitized belt bonding and specially formulated rubber compounds provide superior resistance to aging caused by wear, oil, heat, and harmful environmental factors. The Variable Speed Cog-Belt has been engineered to the same high standards that Timken Belts uses to produce belts for original equipment manufacturers (OEMs).

Features/Advantages

  • Smooth running

  • Oil and heat resistant

  • Long belt life

  • Wide selection of sizes

  • Static dissipating

Applications

Sizes

description: Carlisle SPBX2410MS Power-Wedge Cog-Belt
additional_description:
More Grip. Less Slip. The Metric Power-Wedge Cog-Belt combines the advantages of the narrow wedge design with raw edge performance for maximum operating efficiency in a compact drive package. The narrow profile permits reduced drive widths and a smaller drive envelope. Higher horsepower ratings translate into greater design flexibility — reducing drive cost, space and weight.

The Power-Wedge Cog-Belt is now made of EPDM (Ethylene Propylene Diene Monomer), a synthetic rubber with outstanding properties. The raw-edge construction contributes to outstanding operating efficiency. More torque with little or no slippage. The result is savings — in time, in belt life and in energy costs.

Features/Advantages

  • High horsepower ratings

  • Design flexibility

  • Longer belt life

  • Durable                                                                         

  • Oil and heat resistant

  • Static conductive

  • Resists hardening and glazing

  • Broad operating temperature range (-50°F to +250°F)

  • Smoother running

  • Energy efficient

  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Drives that require metric cross sections on industrial machinery, fans, pumps, and more

Sizes

  • Available in SPZX, SPAX, SPBX, and SPCX cross sections from 643mm to 5092mm. Also available in 3VX, 5VX, and 8VX imperial sizes. Where applicable, belts are dual branded with imperial and metric part numbers.

description: Carlisle 5V1000MS Super Power-Wedge V-Belt
additional_description:
Wedge-Band is the banded version of the hard-working Super Power-Wedge v-belt. Wedge-Band is an excellent choice for virtually any application where increased horsepower capacity and output is needed, or where conventional multiple belt drives are impractical because of space or weight limitations. The specially compounded wrapped construction is ideal for clutching operations. Banded v-belts are ideally suited for pulsating or heavily shock loaded drives and drives with extremely long center distances. Wedge-Band is oil and heat resistant, static dissipating, and it won’t turn over or jump off the drive.

Features/Advantages

  • Prevents belt whip and rollover on long center distance drives

  • Smoother clutching

  • Space and weight saver

  • Oversized polyester cord provides added belt strength and stability

  • Cord is chemically treated for resistance to belt stretch

  • Tie-band is highly engineered to permanently bond multiple belts together enabling the belts to function as a single unit with even load distribution and wear

  • Vibration is dampened

  • Heavy shock loads are absorbed

Applications

  • Mud pumps, rock crushers, stump grinders, and more

Sizes

  • R3V, R5V and R8V cross-sections from 34" to 601"

description: Carlisle A98 Super Ii V-Belt
additional_description:
The Problem Solver! Super II v-belts are the solution to the constant and costly problem of replacing ordinary v-belts on troublesome drives. Specially formulated fiber-loaded EPDM rubber compounds, engineered fabrics and high-modulus polyester cord offer greater strength, longer life, better heat dissipation and higher efficiencies than best-in-class wrapped v-belts. The unique CNA (central neutral axis) cord placement positions the strength of the belt lower on the pulleys to maintain stability and prevent roll-over. The raw edge construction results in more efficient power transmission and reduced energy loss.

Features/Advantages

  • Higher performance alternative to classical wrapped v-belts
  • More energy efficient than wrapped v-belts
  • Unique design for longer life
  • Less maintenance and downtime
  • EPDM rubber compound is static conductive, resistant to hardening and glazing, and operates in a broad temperature range (-50ºF to +250ºF)
  • Backed by our Iron Clad Guarantee
  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Shaker screens, debarkers, industrial washers and dryers, and more

Sizes

  • A, B and C cross-sections from 17" to 144"

description: Carlisle 14MXT-1610-68 Panther XT Synchronous Belt
additional_description:
PowerMiser™ is a powerful, but simple web based application for desktop and mobile use that identifies estimated annual energy costs, savings and payback that can be realized by upgrading to Carlisle belts by Timken.

Open PowerMiser

Reduce Downtime and Save

With the energy efficient Gold-Ribbon, Power-Wedge, Super II, and Durapower II v-belts or Panther and Panther XT synchronous belts, you’ll gain improved system wide performance. Although initial cost may be slightly higher than ordinary belts, payback is significant - and begins immediately! Use PowerMiser to calculate the savings. For superior performance and energy savings you can count on Carlisle belts by Timken.

NOTE: PowerMiser is a free web application and is not available from the App store.

description: Carlisle AP180MS Super Blue Ribbon V-Belt
additional_description:
The finest wrapped belt in the industry and workhorse of classical V-belts. Super Blue Ribbon v-belts assure dependable length stability and require less re-tensioning and take-up. The cord is coated with a special compound that produces a secure, long-lasting bond with the surrounding rubber. The heavy-duty fabric cover protects the core. Its extra flexibility permits the belt to bend more easily around the smallest pulleys with less strain on the fabric. Longer belt life results in less frequent replacement, less downtime and lower maintenance costs.

Features/Advantages

  • Dependable performance on classical belt drives
  • Heavy duty cover is impregnated with oil and heat resistant rubber
  • Resists flex fatigue
  • Longer belt life
  • Smoother running
  • Backed by our Iron Clad Guarantee
  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Mixers, pumps, conveyors, any and everything, and more

Sizes

  • AP, BP, CP, DP, EP cross-sections from 22" to 664"

description: Carlisle BP111MS Super Blue Ribbon V-Belt
additional_description:
The finest wrapped belt in the industry and workhorse of classical V-belts. Super Blue Ribbon v-belts assure dependable length stability and require less re-tensioning and take-up. The cord is coated with a special compound that produces a secure, long-lasting bond with the surrounding rubber. The heavy-duty fabric cover protects the core. Its extra flexibility permits the belt to bend more easily around the smallest pulleys with less strain on the fabric. Longer belt life results in less frequent replacement, less downtime and lower maintenance costs.

Features/Advantages

  • Dependable performance on classical belt drives
  • Heavy duty cover is impregnated with oil and heat resistant rubber
  • Resists flex fatigue
  • Longer belt life
  • Smoother running
  • Backed by our Iron Clad Guarantee
  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Mixers, pumps, conveyors, any and everything, and more

Sizes

  • AP, BP, CP, DP, EP cross-sections from 22" to 664"

description: Carlisle A92MS Super II V-Belt
additional_description:
The Problem Solver! Super II v-belts are the solution to the constant and costly problem of replacing ordinary v-belts on troublesome drives. Specially formulated fiber-loaded EPDM rubber compounds, engineered fabrics and high-modulus polyester cord offer greater strength, longer life, better heat dissipation and higher efficiencies than best-in-class wrapped v-belts. The unique CNA (central neutral axis) cord placement positions the strength of the belt lower on the pulleys to maintain stability and prevent roll-over. The raw edge construction results in more efficient power transmission and reduced energy loss.

Features/Advantages

  • Higher performance alternative to classical wrapped v-belts
  • More energy efficient than wrapped v-belts
  • Unique design for longer life
  • Less maintenance and downtime
  • EPDM rubber compound is static conductive, resistant to hardening and glazing, and operates in a broad temperature range (-50ºF to +250ºF)
  • Backed by our Iron Clad Guarantee
  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Shaker screens, debarkers, industrial washers and dryers, and more

Sizes

  • A, B and C cross-sections from 17" to 144"

description: Carlisle RBP140-6 Super Vee-Band Belt
additional_description:
The Super Vee-Band belt is an ideal choice on classical drives where individual v-belts tend to roll over or whip severely on the drive due to fluctuating load conditions or harsh drive vibration. The individual ribs are permanently joined together at the top with a reinforced fabric tie-band preventing the individual belts from coming off the drive.

Features/Advantages

  • Prevents belt whip and rollover on long center distance drives

  • Tie-Band is highly engineered to permanently bond multiple belts together enabling the belts to function as a single unit with even load distribution and wear

  • Excellent oil and heat resistance, static dissipating

  • Vibration is dampened

  • Heavy shock loads are absorbed

Applications

  • Rock crushers, vibrating equipment, saws, pumps, and more

Sizes

  • RBP, RCP and RDP cross-sections from 39" to 663"

description: Carlisle SPBX3250MS Power-Wedge Cog-Belt
additional_description:
More Grip. Less Slip. The Metric Power-Wedge Cog-Belt combines the advantages of the narrow wedge design with raw edge performance for maximum operating efficiency in a compact drive package. The narrow profile permits reduced drive widths and a smaller drive envelope. Higher horsepower ratings translate into greater design flexibility — reducing drive cost, space and weight.

The Power-Wedge Cog-Belt is now made of EPDM (Ethylene Propylene Diene Monomer), a synthetic rubber with outstanding properties. The raw-edge construction contributes to outstanding operating efficiency. More torque with little or no slippage. The result is savings — in time, in belt life and in energy costs.

Features/Advantages

  • High horsepower ratings

  • Design flexibility

  • Longer belt life

  • Durable                                                                         

  • Oil and heat resistant

  • Static conductive

  • Resists hardening and glazing

  • Broad operating temperature range (-50°F to +250°F)

  • Smoother running

  • Energy efficient

  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Drives that require metric cross sections on industrial machinery, fans, pumps, and more

Sizes

  • Available in SPZX, SPAX, SPBX, and SPCX cross sections from 643mm to 5092mm. Also available in 3VX, 5VX, and 8VX imperial sizes. Where applicable, belts are dual branded with imperial and metric part numbers.

description: Carlisle 5V750MS Super Power-Wedge V-Belt
additional_description:
Wedge-Band is the banded version of the hard-working Super Power-Wedge v-belt. Wedge-Band is an excellent choice for virtually any application where increased horsepower capacity and output is needed, or where conventional multiple belt drives are impractical because of space or weight limitations. The specially compounded wrapped construction is ideal for clutching operations. Banded v-belts are ideally suited for pulsating or heavily shock loaded drives and drives with extremely long center distances. Wedge-Band is oil and heat resistant, static dissipating, and it won’t turn over or jump off the drive.

Features/Advantages

  • Prevents belt whip and rollover on long center distance drives

  • Smoother clutching

  • Space and weight saver

  • Oversized polyester cord provides added belt strength and stability

  • Cord is chemically treated for resistance to belt stretch

  • Tie-band is highly engineered to permanently bond multiple belts together enabling the belts to function as a single unit with even load distribution and wear

  • Vibration is dampened

  • Heavy shock loads are absorbed

Applications

  • Mud pumps, rock crushers, stump grinders, and more

Sizes

  • R3V, R5V and R8V cross-sections from 34" to 601"

description: Carlisle SPBX4560MS Power-Wedge Cog-Belt
additional_description:
More Grip. Less Slip. The Metric Power-Wedge Cog-Belt combines the advantages of the narrow wedge design with raw edge performance for maximum operating efficiency in a compact drive package. The narrow profile permits reduced drive widths and a smaller drive envelope. Higher horsepower ratings translate into greater design flexibility — reducing drive cost, space and weight.

The Power-Wedge Cog-Belt is now made of EPDM (Ethylene Propylene Diene Monomer), a synthetic rubber with outstanding properties. The raw-edge construction contributes to outstanding operating efficiency. More torque with little or no slippage. The result is savings — in time, in belt life and in energy costs.

Features/Advantages

  • High horsepower ratings

  • Design flexibility

  • Longer belt life

  • Durable                                                                         

  • Oil and heat resistant

  • Static conductive

  • Resists hardening and glazing

  • Broad operating temperature range (-50°F to +250°F)

  • Smoother running

  • Energy efficient

  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Drives that require metric cross sections on industrial machinery, fans, pumps, and more

Sizes

  • Available in SPZX, SPAX, SPBX, and SPCX cross sections from 643mm to 5092mm. Also available in 3VX, 5VX, and 8VX imperial sizes. Where applicable, belts are dual branded with imperial and metric part numbers.

description: Carlisle 916R109 Round Belts
additional_description:
Round belts are a high performance solution for conveyors, quarter-turn, twisted, and serpentine drives. Our round belts feature a no-splice construction for added durability with minimal stretch for minimum take-up requirements.

  • Heavy duty stress-relieved fabric cover flexes better for improved belt life

  • Hi-modulus cords carry horsepower loads with minimum stretch

  • Better belt stability and fewer take-up adjustments

  • Compression section provides uniform cord support and improves belt flex life

  • No splice for added durability.

  • 7/16" and 9/16" diameters from 70" to 762"

description: Carlisle 14MXT-2590-125 Panther XT Synchronous Belt
additional_description:

With the energy efficient Gold-Ribbon, Power-Wedge, Super II, and Durapower II v-belts or Panther and Panther XT synchronous belts, you’ll gain improved system wide performance. description: Carlisle B94MS Super II V-Belt
additional_description:
The Problem Solver! Super II v-belts are the solution to the constant and costly problem of replacing ordinary v-belts on troublesome drives. Specially formulated fiber-loaded EPDM rubber compounds, engineered fabrics and high-modulus polyester cord offer greater strength, longer life, better heat dissipation and higher efficiencies than best-in-class wrapped v-belts. The unique CNA (central neutral axis) cord placement positions the strength of the belt lower on the pulleys to maintain stability and prevent roll-over. The raw edge construction results in more efficient power transmission and reduced energy loss.

Features/Advantages

  • Higher performance alternative to classical wrapped v-belts
  • More energy efficient than wrapped v-belts
  • Unique design for longer life
  • Less maintenance and downtime
  • EPDM rubber compound is static conductive, resistant to hardening and glazing, and operates in a broad temperature range (-50ºF to +250ºF)
  • Backed by our Iron Clad Guarantee
  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Shaker screens, debarkers, industrial washers and dryers, and more

Sizes

  • A, B and C cross-sections from 17" to 144"

description: Carlisle RDP180-4MS Super Vee-Band Belt
additional_description:
The Super Vee-Band belt is an ideal choice on classical drives where individual v-belts tend to roll over or whip severely on the drive due to fluctuating load conditions or harsh drive vibration. The individual ribs are permanently joined together at the top with a reinforced fabric tie-band preventing the individual belts from coming off the drive.

Features/Advantages

  • Prevents belt whip and rollover on long center distance drives

  • Tie-Band is highly engineered to permanently bond multiple belts together enabling the belts to function as a single unit with even load distribution and wear

  • Excellent oil and heat resistance, static dissipating

  • Vibration is dampened

  • Heavy shock loads are absorbed

Applications

  • Rock crushers, vibrating equipment, saws, pumps, and more

Sizes

  • RBP, RCP and RDP cross-sections from 39" to 663"

description: Carlisle 8V4250MS Super Power-Wedge V-Belt
additional_description:
Wedge-Band is the banded version of the hard-working Super Power-Wedge v-belt. Wedge-Band is an excellent choice for virtually any application where increased horsepower capacity and output is needed, or where conventional multiple belt drives are impractical because of space or weight limitations. The specially compounded wrapped construction is ideal for clutching operations. Banded v-belts are ideally suited for pulsating or heavily shock loaded drives and drives with extremely long center distances. Wedge-Band is oil and heat resistant, static dissipating, and it won’t turn over or jump off the drive.

Features/Advantages

  • Prevents belt whip and rollover on long center distance drives

  • Smoother clutching

  • Space and weight saver

  • Oversized polyester cord provides added belt strength and stability

  • Cord is chemically treated for resistance to belt stretch

  • Tie-band is highly engineered to permanently bond multiple belts together enabling the belts to function as a single unit with even load distribution and wear

  • Vibration is dampened

  • Heavy shock loads are absorbed

Applications

  • Mud pumps, rock crushers, stump grinders, and more

Sizes

  • R3V, R5V and R8V cross-sections from 34" to 601"

description:
The finest wrapped belt in the industry and workhorse of classical V-belts. Super Blue Ribbon v-belts assure dependable length stability and require less re-tensioning and take-up. The cord is coated with a special compound that produces a secure, long-lasting bond with the surrounding rubber. The heavy-duty fabric cover protects the core. Its extra flexibility permits the belt to bend more easily around the smallest pulleys with less strain on the fabric. Longer belt life results in less frequent replacement, less downtime and lower maintenance costs.

Features/Advantages

  • Dependable performance on classical belt drives
  • Heavy duty cover is impregnated with oil and heat resistant rubber
  • Resists flex fatigue
  • Longer belt life
  • Smoother running
  • Backed by our Iron Clad Guarantee
  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Mixers, pumps, conveyors, any and everything, and more

Sizes

  • AP, BP, CP, DP, EP cross-sections from 22" to 664"

PowerMiser™ is a powerful, but simple web based application for desktop and mobile use that identifies estimated annual energy costs, savings and payback that can be realized by upgrading to Carlisle belts by Timken.

Open PowerMiser

Reduce Downtime and Save

With the energy efficient Gold-Ribbon, Power-Wedge, Super II, and Durapower II v-belts or Panther and Panther XT synchronous belts, you’ll gain improved system wide performance. Although initial cost may be slightly higher than ordinary belts, payback is significant - and begins immediately! Use PowerMiser to calculate the savings. For superior performance and energy savings you can count on Carlisle belts by Timken.

NOTE: PowerMiser is a free web application and is not available from the App store.

Wedge-Band is the banded version of the hard-working Super Power-Wedge v-belt. Wedge-Band is an excellent choice for virtually any application where increased horsepower capacity and output is needed, or where conventional multiple belt drives are impractical because of space or weight limitations. The specially compounded wrapped construction is ideal for clutching operations. Banded v-belts are ideally suited for pulsating or heavily shock loaded drives and drives with extremely long center distances. Wedge-Band is oil and heat resistant, static dissipating, and it won’t turn over or jump off the drive.

Features/Advantages

  • Prevents belt whip and rollover on long center distance drives

  • Smoother clutching

  • Space and weight saver

  • Oversized polyester cord provides added belt strength and stability

  • Cord is chemically treated for resistance to belt stretch

  • Tie-band is highly engineered to permanently bond multiple belts together enabling the belts to function as a single unit with even load distribution and wear

  • Vibration is dampened

  • Heavy shock loads are absorbed

Applications

  • Mud pumps, rock crushers, stump grinders, and more

Sizes

  • R3V, R5V and R8V cross-sections from 34" to 601"

The Problem Solver! Super II v-belts are the solution to the constant and costly problem of replacing ordinary v-belts on troublesome drives. Specially formulated fiber-loaded EPDM rubber compounds, engineered fabrics and high-modulus polyester cord offer greater strength, longer life, better heat dissipation and higher efficiencies than best-in-class wrapped v-belts. The unique CNA (central neutral axis) cord placement positions the strength of the belt lower on the pulleys to maintain stability and prevent roll-over. The raw edge construction results in more efficient power transmission and reduced energy loss.

Features/Advantages

  • Higher performance alternative to classical wrapped v-belts
  • More energy efficient than wrapped v-belts
  • Unique design for longer life
  • Less maintenance and downtime
  • EPDM rubber compound is static conductive, resistant to hardening and glazing, and operates in a broad temperature range (-50ºF to +250ºF)
  • Backed by our Iron Clad Guarantee
  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Shaker screens, debarkers, industrial washers and dryers, and more

Sizes

  • A, B and C cross-sections from 17" to 144"

Round belts are a high performance solution for conveyors, quarter-turn, twisted, and serpentine drives. Our round belts feature a no-splice construction for added durability with minimal stretch for minimum take-up requirements.

Features/Advantages

  • Heavy duty stress-relieved fabric cover flexes better for improved belt life

  • Hi-modulus cords carry horsepower loads with minimum stretch

  • Better belt stability and fewer take-up adjustments

  • Compression section provides uniform cord support and improves belt flex life

  • No splice for added durability.

Applications

  • Conveyors, commercial sewing machines, quarter-turn drives, twisted drives, serpentine drives and more

Sizes

  • 7/16" and 9/16" diameters from 70" to 762"

The original deep-groove notched design is specifically developed for double angle “CC” drives commonly found in the demanding textile industry. The deep groove prevents belt rollover while the notches provide added flexibility and longer life.

Features/Advantages

  • Multiple ply fabric cord provides superior strength and durability

  • Strong yet flexible for power transmission from both sides of the belt

  • Resistant to oil and heat

  • Static conductive

Applications

  • Drives with long center, serpentine applications usually found in the textile industry

NOTE: Dry Can belts are normally used as a single belt on a drive and matching is not required. When ordering two or more Dry Can belts to be used as a matched set on the same drive, please specify that the belts must be a matched set.

Sizes

  • Cross-section from 212" to 902"

More Grip. Less Slip. The Metric Power-Wedge Cog-Belt combines the advantages of the narrow wedge design with raw edge performance for maximum operating efficiency in a compact drive package. The narrow profile permits reduced drive widths and a smaller drive envelope. Higher horsepower ratings translate into greater design flexibility — reducing drive cost, space and weight.

The Power-Wedge Cog-Belt is now made of EPDM (Ethylene Propylene Diene Monomer), a synthetic rubber with outstanding properties. The raw-edge construction contributes to outstanding operating efficiency. More torque with little or no slippage. The result is savings — in time, in belt life and in energy costs.

Features/Advantages

  • High horsepower ratings

  • Design flexibility

  • Longer belt life

  • Durable                                                                         

  • Oil and heat resistant

  • Static conductive

  • Resists hardening and glazing

  • Broad operating temperature range (-50°F to +250°F)

  • Smoother running

  • Energy efficient

  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Drives that require metric cross sections on industrial machinery, fans, pumps, and more

Sizes

  • Available in SPZX, SPAX, SPBX, and SPCX cross sections from 643mm to 5092mm. Also available in 3VX, 5VX, and 8VX imperial sizes. Where applicable, belts are dual branded with imperial and metric part numbers.

The finest wrapped belt in the industry and workhorse of classical V-belts. Super Blue Ribbon v-belts assure dependable length stability and require less re-tensioning and take-up. The Problem Solver! Super II v-belts are the solution to the constant and costly problem of replacing ordinary v-belts on troublesome drives. Specially formulated fiber-loaded EPDM rubber compounds, engineered fabrics and high-modulus polyester cord offer greater strength, longer life, better heat dissipation and higher efficiencies than best-in-class wrapped v-belts. The unique CNA (central neutral axis) cord placement positions the strength of the belt lower on the pulleys to maintain stability and prevent roll-over. The raw edge construction results in more efficient power transmission and reduced energy loss.

Features/Advantages

  • Higher performance alternative to classical wrapped v-belts
  • More energy efficient than wrapped v-belts
  • Unique design for longer life
  • Less maintenance and downtime
  • EPDM rubber compound is static conductive, resistant to hardening and glazing, and operates in a broad temperature range (-50ºF to +250ºF)
  • Backed by our Iron Clad Guarantee
  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Shaker screens, debarkers, industrial washers and dryers, and more

  • A, B and C cross-sections from 17" to 144"

More Grip. Less Slip. The Metric Power-Wedge Cog-Belt combines the advantages of the narrow wedge design with raw edge performance for maximum operating efficiency in a compact drive package. The narrow profile permits reduced drive widths and a smaller drive envelope. Higher horsepower ratings translate into greater design flexibility — reducing drive cost, space and weight.

The Power-Wedge Cog-Belt is now made of EPDM (Ethylene Propylene Diene Monomer), a synthetic rubber with outstanding properties. The raw-edge construction contributes to outstanding operating efficiency. More torque with little or no slippage. The result is savings — in time, in belt life and in energy costs.

Features/Advantages

  • High horsepower ratings

  • Design flexibility

  • Longer belt life

  • Durable                                                                         

  • Oil and heat resistant

  • Static conductive

  • Resists hardening and glazing

  • Broad operating temperature range (-50°F to +250°F)

  • Smoother running

  • Energy efficient

  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Drives that require metric cross sections on industrial machinery, fans, pumps, and more

Sizes

  • Available in SPZX, SPAX, SPBX, and SPCX cross sections from 643mm to 5092mm. Also available in 3VX, 5VX, and 8VX imperial sizes. Where applicable, belts are dual branded with imperial and metric part numbers.

Round belts are a high performance solution for conveyors, quarter-turn, twisted, and serpentine drives. Our round belts feature a no-splice construction for added durability with minimal stretch for minimum take-up requirements.

Features/Advantages

  • Heavy duty stress-relieved fabric cover flexes better for improved belt life

  • Hi-modulus cords carry horsepower loads with minimum stretch

  • Better belt stability and fewer take-up adjustments

  • Compression section provides uniform cord support and improves belt flex life

  • No splice for added durability.

Applications

  • Conveyors, commercial sewing machines, quarter-turn drives, twisted drives, serpentine drives and more

Sizes

  • 7/16" and 9/16" diameters from 70" to 762"

Wedge-Band is the banded version of the hard-working Super Power-Wedge v-belt. Wedge-Band is an excellent choice for virtually any application where increased horsepower capacity and output is needed, or where conventional multiple belt drives are impractical because of space or weight limitations. The specially compounded wrapped construction is ideal for clutching operations. Banded v-belts are ideally suited for pulsating or heavily shock loaded drives and drives with extremely long center distances. Wedge-Band is oil and heat resistant, static dissipating, and it won’t turn over or jump off the drive.

Features/Advantages

  • Prevents belt whip and rollover on long center distance drives

  • Smoother clutching

  • Space and weight saver

  • Oversized polyester cord provides added belt strength and stability

  • Cord is chemically treated for resistance to belt stretch

  • Tie-band is highly engineered to permanently bond multiple belts together enabling the belts to function as a single unit with even load distribution and wear

  • Vibration is dampened

  • Heavy shock loads are absorbed

Applications

  • Mud pumps, rock crushers, stump grinders, and more

Sizes

  • R3V, R5V and R8V cross-sections from 34" to 601"

Round belts are a high performance solution for conveyors, quarter-turn, twisted, and serpentine drives. Our round belts feature a no-splice construction for added durability with minimal stretch for minimum take-up requirements.

With the energy efficient Gold-Ribbon, Power-Wedge, Super II, and Durapower II v-belts or Panther and Panther XT synchronous belts, you’ll gain improved system wide performance. More Grip. Less Slip. The Metric Power-Wedge Cog-Belt combines the advantages of the narrow wedge design with raw edge performance for maximum operating efficiency in a compact drive package. The narrow profile permits reduced drive widths and a smaller drive envelope. Higher horsepower ratings translate into greater design flexibility — reducing drive cost, space and weight.

The Power-Wedge Cog-Belt is now made of EPDM (Ethylene Propylene Diene Monomer), a synthetic rubber with outstanding properties. The raw-edge construction contributes to outstanding operating efficiency. More torque with little or no slippage. The result is savings — in time, in belt life and in energy costs.

Features/Advantages

  • High horsepower ratings

  • Design flexibility

  • Longer belt life

  • Durable                                                                         

  • Oil and heat resistant

  • Static conductive

  • Resists hardening and glazing

  • Broad operating temperature range (-50°F to +250°F)

  • Smoother running

  • Energy efficient

  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Drives that require metric cross sections on industrial machinery, fans, pumps, and more

Sizes

  • Available in SPZX, SPAX, SPBX, and SPCX cross sections from 643mm to 5092mm. Also available in 3VX, 5VX, and 8VX imperial sizes. Where applicable, belts are dual branded with imperial and metric part numbers.

Wedge-Band is the banded version of the hard-working Super Power-Wedge v-belt. Wedge-Band is an excellent choice for virtually any application where increased horsepower capacity and output is needed, or where conventional multiple belt drives are impractical because of space or weight limitations. The specially compounded wrapped construction is ideal for clutching operations. Banded v-belts are ideally suited for pulsating or heavily shock loaded drives and drives with extremely long center distances. Wedge-Band is oil and heat resistant, static dissipating, and it won’t turn over or jump off the drive.

Features/Advantages

  • Prevents belt whip and rollover on long center distance drives

  • Smoother clutching

  • Space and weight saver

  • Oversized polyester cord provides added belt strength and stability

  • Cord is chemically treated for resistance to belt stretch

  • Tie-band is highly engineered to permanently bond multiple belts together enabling the belts to function as a single unit with even load distribution and wear

  • Vibration is dampened

  • Heavy shock loads are absorbed

Applications

  • Mud pumps, rock crushers, stump grinders, and more

Sizes

  • R3V, R5V and R8V cross-sections from 34" to 601"

Vee-Rib belts are ideally suited for high speed drives where conventional v-belts cannot operate. The Vee-Rib belt provides smooth, vibration-free performance in a compact drive. The special “truncated” rib design enhances belt flexibility and resists cracking better than non-truncated v-ribbed belts. Vee-Rib is resistant to oil, heat and abrasion for longer belt life.

Features/Advantages

  • Vibration-free

  • Heat resistant

  • Maximum flexibility

  • High horsepower

  • Abrasion resistant

Applications

  • Industrial dryers, fitness equipment, machine tools, high speed blowers, and more

Sizes

  • J cross-section from 13" to 98"

More Grip. Less Slip. The Metric Power-Wedge Cog-Belt combines the advantages of the narrow wedge design with raw edge performance for maximum operating efficiency in a compact drive package. The narrow profile permits reduced drive widths and a smaller drive envelope. Higher horsepower ratings translate into greater design flexibility — reducing drive cost, space and weight.

The Power-Wedge Cog-Belt is now made of EPDM (Ethylene Propylene Diene Monomer), a synthetic rubber with outstanding properties. The raw-edge construction contributes to outstanding operating efficiency. More torque with little or no slippage. The result is savings — in time, in belt life and in energy costs.

Features/Advantages

  • High horsepower ratings

  • Design flexibility

  • Longer belt life

  • Durable                                                                         

  • Oil and heat resistant

  • Static conductive

  • Resists hardening and glazing

  • Broad operating temperature range (-50°F to +250°F)

  • Smoother running

  • Energy efficient

  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Drives that require metric cross sections on industrial machinery, fans, pumps, and more

Sizes

  • Available in SPZX, SPAX, SPBX, and SPCX cross sections from 643mm to 5092mm. Also available in 3VX, 5VX, and 8VX imperial sizes. Where applicable, belts are dual branded with imperial and metric part numbers.

Wedge-Band is the banded version of the hard-working Super Power-Wedge v-belt. Wedge-Band is an excellent choice for virtually any application where increased horsepower capacity and output is needed, or where conventional multiple belt drives are impractical because of space or weight limitations. The specially compounded wrapped construction is ideal for clutching operations. Banded v-belts are ideally suited for pulsating or heavily shock loaded drives and drives with extremely long center distances. Wedge-Band is oil and heat resistant, static dissipating, and it won’t turn over or jump off the drive.

Features/Advantages

  • Prevents belt whip and rollover on long center distance drives

  • Smoother clutching

  • Space and weight saver

  • Oversized polyester cord provides added belt strength and stability

  • Cord is chemically treated for resistance to belt stretch

  • Tie-band is highly engineered to permanently bond multiple belts together enabling the belts to function as a single unit with even load distribution and wear

  • Vibration is dampened

  • Heavy shock loads are absorbed

Applications

  • Mud pumps, rock crushers, stump grinders, and more

Sizes

  • R3V, R5V and R8V cross-sections from 34" to 601"

The Problem Solver! Super II v-belts are the solution to the constant and costly problem of replacing ordinary v-belts on troublesome drives. Specially formulated fiber-loaded EPDM rubber compounds, engineered fabrics and high-modulus polyester cord offer greater strength, longer life, better heat dissipation and higher efficiencies than best-in-class wrapped v-belts. The unique CNA (central neutral axis) cord placement positions the strength of the belt lower on the pulleys to maintain stability and prevent roll-over. The raw edge construction results in more efficient power transmission and reduced energy loss.

Features/Advantages

  • Higher performance alternative to classical wrapped v-belts
  • More energy efficient than wrapped v-belts
  • Unique design for longer life
  • Less maintenance and downtime
  • EPDM rubber compound is static conductive, resistant to hardening and glazing, and operates in a broad temperature range (-50ºF to +250ºF)
  • Backed by our Iron Clad Guarantee
  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Shaker screens, debarkers, industrial washers and dryers, and more

Sizes

  • A, B and C cross-sections from 17" to 144"

The Super Vee-Band belt is an ideal choice on classical drives where individual v-belts tend to roll over or whip severely on the drive due to fluctuating load conditions or harsh drive vibration. The Problem Solver! Super II v-belts are the solution to the constant and costly problem of replacing ordinary v-belts on troublesome drives. Specially formulated fiber-loaded EPDM rubber compounds, engineered fabrics and high-modulus polyester cord offer greater strength, longer life, better heat dissipation and higher efficiencies than best-in-class wrapped v-belts. The unique CNA (central neutral axis) cord placement positions the strength of the belt lower on the pulleys to maintain stability and prevent roll-over. The raw edge construction results in more efficient power transmission and reduced energy loss.

Features/Advantages

  • Higher performance alternative to classical wrapped v-belts
  • More energy efficient than wrapped v-belts
  • Unique design for longer life
  • Less maintenance and downtime
  • EPDM rubber compound is static conductive, resistant to hardening and glazing, and operates in a broad temperature range (-50ºF to +250ºF)
  • Backed by our Iron Clad Guarantee
  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Shaker screens, debarkers, industrial washers and dryers, and more

Sizes

  • A, B and C cross-sections from 17" to 144"

More Grip. Less Slip. The Metric Power-Wedge Cog-Belt combines the advantages of the narrow wedge design with raw edge performance for maximum operating efficiency in a compact drive package. The narrow profile permits reduced drive widths and a smaller drive envelope. Higher horsepower ratings translate into greater design flexibility — reducing drive cost, space and weight.

The Power-Wedge Cog-Belt is now made of EPDM (Ethylene Propylene Diene Monomer), a synthetic rubber with outstanding properties. The raw-edge construction contributes to outstanding operating efficiency. More torque with little or no slippage. The result is savings — in time, in belt life and in energy costs.

Features/Advantages

  • High horsepower ratings

  • Design flexibility

  • Longer belt life

  • Durable                                                                         

  • Oil and heat resistant

  • Static conductive

  • Resists hardening and glazing

  • Broad operating temperature range (-50°F to +250°F)

  • Smoother running

  • Energy efficient

  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Drives that require metric cross sections on industrial machinery, fans, pumps, and more

  • Available in SPZX, SPAX, SPBX, and SPCX cross sections from 643mm to 5092mm. Also available in 3VX, 5VX, and 8VX imperial sizes. Where applicable, belts are dual branded with imperial and metric part numbers.

Wedge-Band is the banded version of the hard-working Super Power-Wedge v-belt. Wedge-Band is an excellent choice for virtually any application where increased horsepower capacity and output is needed, or where conventional multiple belt drives are impractical because of space or weight limitations. The specially compounded wrapped construction is ideal for clutching operations. Banded v-belts are ideally suited for pulsating or heavily shock loaded drives and drives with extremely long center distances. Wedge-Band is oil and heat resistant, static dissipating, and it won’t turn over or jump off the drive.

Features/Advantages

  • Prevents belt whip and rollover on long center distance drives

  • Smoother clutching

  • Space and weight saver

  • Oversized polyester cord provides added belt strength and stability

  • Cord is chemically treated for resistance to belt stretch

  • Tie-band is highly engineered to permanently bond multiple belts together enabling the belts to function as a single unit with even load distribution and wear

  • Vibration is dampened

  • Heavy shock loads are absorbed

Applications

  • Mud pumps, rock crushers, stump grinders, and more

Sizes

  • R3V, R5V and R8V cross-sections from 34" to 601"

More Grip. Less Slip. The Metric Power-Wedge Cog-Belt combines the advantages of the narrow wedge design with raw edge performance for maximum operating efficiency in a compact drive package. The narrow profile permits reduced drive widths and a smaller drive envelope. Higher horsepower ratings translate into greater design flexibility — reducing drive cost, space and weight.

The Power-Wedge Cog-Belt is now made of EPDM (Ethylene Propylene Diene Monomer), a synthetic rubber with outstanding properties. The raw-edge construction contributes to outstanding operating efficiency. More torque with little or no slippage. The result is savings — in time, in belt life and in energy costs.

Features/Advantages

  • High horsepower ratings

  • Design flexibility

  • Longer belt life

  • Durable                                                                         

  • Oil and heat resistant

  • Static conductive

  • Resists hardening and glazing

  • Broad operating temperature range (-50°F to +250°F)

  • Smoother running

  • Energy efficient

  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Drives that require metric cross sections on industrial machinery, fans, pumps, and more

The Problem Solver! Super II v-belts are the solution to the constant and costly problem of replacing ordinary v-belts on troublesome drives. The finest wrapped belt in the industry and workhorse of classical V-belts. Super Blue Ribbon v-belts assure dependable length stability and require less re-tensioning and take-up. The cord is coated with a special compound that produces a secure, long-lasting bond with the surrounding rubber. The heavy-duty fabric cover protects the core. Its extra flexibility permits the belt to bend more easily around the smallest pulleys with less strain on the fabric. Longer belt life results in less frequent replacement, less downtime and lower maintenance costs.

The Super Vee-Band belt is an ideal choice on classical drives where individual v-belts tend to roll over or whip severely on the drive due to fluctuating load conditions or harsh drive vibration. The individual ribs are permanently joined together at the top with a reinforced fabric tie-band preventing the individual belts from coming off the drive.

Features/Advantages

  • Prevents belt whip and rollover on long center distance drives

  • Tie-Band is highly engineered to permanently bond multiple belts together enabling the belts to function as a single unit with even load distribution and wear

  • Excellent oil and heat resistance, static dissipating

  • Vibration is dampened

  • Heavy shock loads are absorbed

Applications

  • Rock crushers, vibrating equipment, saws, pumps, and more

Sizes

  • RBP, RCP and RDP cross-sections from 39" to 663"

The Problem Solver! Super II v-belts are the solution to the constant and costly problem of replacing ordinary v-belts on troublesome drives. Specially formulated fiber-loaded EPDM rubber compounds, engineered fabrics and high-modulus polyester cord offer greater strength, longer life, better heat dissipation and higher efficiencies than best-in-class wrapped v-belts. The unique CNA (central neutral axis) cord placement positions the strength of the belt lower on the pulleys to maintain stability and prevent roll-over. The raw edge construction results in more efficient power transmission and reduced energy loss.

Features/Advantages

  • Higher performance alternative to classical wrapped v-belts
  • More energy efficient than wrapped v-belts
  • Unique design for longer life
  • Less maintenance and downtime
  • EPDM rubber compound is static conductive, resistant to hardening and glazing, and operates in a broad temperature range (-50ºF to +250ºF)
  • Backed by our Iron Clad Guarantee
  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Shaker screens, debarkers, industrial washers and dryers, and more

Sizes

  • A, B and C cross-sections from 17" to 144"

Replaces:
ALLIS CHALMERS1504568
CASE/IH482223R2

The finest wrapped belt in the industry and workhorse of classical V-belts. Super Blue Ribbon v-belts assure dependable length stability and require less re-tensioning and take-up. The cord is coated with a special compound that produces a secure, long-lasting bond with the surrounding rubber. The heavy-duty fabric cover protects the core. Its extra flexibility permits the belt to bend more easily around the smallest pulleys with less strain on the fabric. Longer belt life results in less frequent replacement, less downtime and lower maintenance costs.

Features/Advantages

  • Dependable performance on classical belt drives
  • Heavy duty cover is impregnated with oil and heat resistant rubber
  • Resists flex fatigue
  • Longer belt life
  • Smoother running
  • Backed by our Iron Clad Guarantee
  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Mixers, pumps, conveyors, any and everything, and more

Sizes

  • AP, BP, CP, DP, EP cross-sections from 22" to 664"

More Grip. Less Slip. The Metric Power-Wedge Cog-Belt combines the advantages of the narrow wedge design with raw edge performance for maximum operating efficiency in a compact drive package. The narrow profile permits reduced drive widths and a smaller drive envelope. Higher horsepower ratings translate into greater design flexibility — reducing drive cost, space and weight.

The Power-Wedge Cog-Belt is now made of EPDM (Ethylene Propylene Diene Monomer), a synthetic rubber with outstanding properties. The raw-edge construction contributes to outstanding operating efficiency. More torque with little or no slippage. The result is savings — in time, in belt life and in energy costs.

Features/Advantages

  • High horsepower ratings

  • Design flexibility

  • Longer belt life

  • Durable                                                                         

  • Oil and heat resistant

  • Static conductive

  • Resists hardening and glazing

  • Broad operating temperature range (-50°F to +250°F)

  • Smoother running

  • Energy efficient

  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Drives that require metric cross sections on industrial machinery, fans, pumps, and more

Sizes

  • Available in SPZX, SPAX, SPBX, and SPCX cross sections from 643mm to 5092mm. Also available in 3VX, 5VX, and 8VX imperial sizes. Where applicable, belts are dual branded with imperial and metric part numbers.
