Wedge-Band is the banded version of the hard-working Super Power-Wedge v-belt. Wedge-Band is an excellent choice for virtually any application where increased horsepower capacity and output is needed, or where conventional multiple belt drives are impractical because of space or weight limitations. The specially compounded wrapped construction is ideal for clutching operations. Banded v-belts are ideally suited for pulsating or heavily shock loaded drives and drives with extremely long center distances. Wedge-Band is oil and heat resistant, static dissipating, and it won’t turn over or jump off the drive.

Features/Advantages

  • Prevents belt whip and rollover on long center distance drives

  • Smoother clutching

  • Space and weight saver

  • Oversized polyester cord provides added belt strength and stability

  • Cord is chemically treated for resistance to belt stretch

  • Tie-band is highly engineered to permanently bond multiple belts together enabling the belts to function as a single unit with even load distribution and wear

  • Vibration is dampened

  • Heavy shock loads are absorbed

Applications

  • Mud pumps, rock crushers, stump grinders, and more

Sizes

  • R3V, R5V and R8V cross-sections from 34" to 601"

The Problem Solver! Super II v-belts are the solution to the constant and costly problem of replacing ordinary v-belts on troublesome drives. Specially formulated fiber-loaded EPDM rubber compounds, engineered fabrics and high-modulus polyester cord offer greater strength, longer life, better heat dissipation and higher efficiencies than best-in-class wrapped v-belts. The unique CNA (central neutral axis) cord placement positions the strength of the belt lower on the pulleys to maintain stability and prevent roll-over. The raw edge construction results in more efficient power transmission and reduced energy loss.

Features/Advantages

  • Higher performance alternative to classical wrapped v-belts
  • More energy efficient than wrapped v-belts
  • Unique design for longer life
  • Less maintenance and downtime
  • EPDM rubber compound is static conductive, resistant to hardening and glazing, and operates in a broad temperature range (-50ºF to +250ºF)
  • Backed by our Iron Clad Guarantee
  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Shaker screens, debarkers, industrial washers and dryers, and more

Sizes

  • A, B and C cross-sections from 17" to 144"

The original deep-groove notched design is specifically developed for double angle “CC” drives commonly found in the demanding textile industry. The deep groove prevents belt rollover while the notches provide added flexibility and longer life.

Features/Advantages

  • Multiple ply fabric cord provides superior strength and durability

  • Strong yet flexible for power transmission from both sides of the belt

  • Resistant to oil and heat

  • Static conductive

Applications

  • Drives with long center, serpentine applications usually found in the textile industry

NOTE: Dry Can belts are normally used as a single belt on a drive and matching is not required. When ordering two or more Dry Can belts to be used as a matched set on the same drive, please specify that the belts must be a matched set.

Sizes

  • Cross-section from 212" to 902"

The finest wrapped belt in the industry and workhorse of classical V-belts. Super Blue Ribbon v-belts assure dependable length stability and require less re-tensioning and take-up. The cord is coated with a special compound that produces a secure, long-lasting bond with the surrounding rubber. The heavy-duty fabric cover protects the core. Its extra flexibility permits the belt to bend more easily around the smallest pulleys with less strain on the fabric. Longer belt life results in less frequent replacement, less downtime and lower maintenance costs.

Features/Advantages

  • Dependable performance on classical belt drives
  • Heavy duty cover is impregnated with oil and heat resistant rubber
  • Resists flex fatigue
  • Longer belt life
  • Smoother running
  • Backed by our Iron Clad Guarantee
  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Mixers, pumps, conveyors, any and everything, and more

Sizes

  • AP, BP, CP, DP, EP cross-sections from 22" to 664"

The original deep-groove notched design is specifically developed for double angle “CC” drives commonly found in the demanding textile industry. The deep groove prevents belt rollover while the notches provide added flexibility and longer life.

Features/Advantages

  • Multiple ply fabric cord provides superior strength and durability

  • Strong yet flexible for power transmission from both sides of the belt

  • Resistant to oil and heat

  • Static conductive

Applications

  • Drives with long center, serpentine applications usually found in the textile industry

NOTE: Dry Can belts are normally used as a single belt on a drive and matching is not required. When ordering two or more Dry Can belts to be used as a matched set on the same drive, please specify that the belts must be a matched set.

Sizes

  • Cross-section from 212" to 902"

The finest wrapped belt in the industry and workhorse of classical V-belts. Super Blue Ribbon v-belts assure dependable length stability and require less re-tensioning and take-up. The cord is coated with a special compound that produces a secure, long-lasting bond with the surrounding rubber. The heavy-duty fabric cover protects the core. Its extra flexibility permits the belt to bend more easily around the smallest pulleys with less strain on the fabric. Longer belt life results in less frequent replacement, less downtime and lower maintenance costs.

Features/Advantages

  • Dependable performance on classical belt drives
  • Heavy duty cover is impregnated with oil and heat resistant rubber
  • Resists flex fatigue

The Problem Solver! Super II v-belts are the solution to the constant and costly problem of replacing ordinary v-belts on troublesome drives. Specially formulated fiber-loaded EPDM rubber compounds, engineered fabrics and high-modulus polyester cord offer greater strength, longer life, better heat dissipation and higher efficiencies than best-in-class wrapped v-belts. The unique CNA (central neutral axis) cord placement positions the strength of the belt lower on the pulleys to maintain stability and prevent roll-over. The raw edge construction results in more efficient power transmission and reduced energy loss.

Features/Advantages

  • Higher performance alternative to classical wrapped v-belts
  • More energy efficient than wrapped v-belts
  • Unique design for longer life
  • Less maintenance and downtime
  • EPDM rubber compound is static conductive, resistant to hardening and glazing, and operates in a broad temperature range (-50ºF to +250ºF)
  • Backed by our Iron Clad Guarantee
  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Shaker screens, debarkers, industrial washers and dryers, and more

Sizes

  • A, B and C cross-sections from 17" to 144"

More Grip. Less Slip. The Metric Power-Wedge Cog-Belt combines the advantages of the narrow wedge design with raw edge performance for maximum operating efficiency in a compact drive package. The narrow profile permits reduced drive widths and a smaller drive envelope. Higher horsepower ratings translate into greater design flexibility — reducing drive cost, space and weight.

The Power-Wedge Cog-Belt is now made of EPDM (Ethylene Propylene Diene Monomer), a synthetic rubber with outstanding properties. The raw-edge construction contributes to outstanding operating efficiency. More torque with little or no slippage. The result is savings — in time, in belt life and in energy costs.

Round belts are a high performance solution for conveyors, quarter-turn, twisted, and serpentine drives. Our round belts feature a no-splice construction for added durability with minimal stretch for minimum take-up requirements.

Features/Advantages

  • Heavy duty stress-relieved fabric cover flexes better for improved belt life

  • Hi-modulus cords carry horsepower loads with minimum stretch

  • Better belt stability and fewer take-up adjustments

  • Compression section provides uniform cord support and improves belt flex life

  • No splice for added durability.

Applications

  • Conveyors, commercial sewing machines, quarter-turn drives, twisted drives, serpentine drives and more

Sizes

  • 7/16" and 9/16" diameters from 70" to 762"

The Problem Solver! Super II v-belts are the solution to the constant and costly problem of replacing ordinary v-belts on troublesome drives. Specially formulated fiber-loaded EPDM rubber compounds, engineered fabrics and high-modulus polyester cord offer greater strength, longer life, better heat dissipation and higher efficiencies than best-in-class wrapped v-belts. The unique CNA (central neutral axis) cord placement positions the strength of the belt lower on the pulleys to maintain stability and prevent roll-over. The raw edge construction results in more efficient power transmission and reduced energy loss.

Features/Advantages

  • Higher performance alternative to classical wrapped v-belts
  • More energy efficient than wrapped v-belts
  • Unique design for longer life
  • Less maintenance and downtime
  • EPDM rubber compound is static conductive, resistant to hardening and glazing, and operates in a broad temperature range (-50ºF to +250ºF)
  • Backed by our Iron Clad Guarantee
  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Shaker screens, debarkers, industrial washers and dryers, and more

More Grip. Less Slip. The Metric Power-Wedge Cog-Belt combines the advantages of the narrow wedge design with raw edge performance for maximum operating efficiency in a compact drive package. The narrow profile permits reduced drive widths and a smaller drive envelope. Higher horsepower ratings translate into greater design flexibility — reducing drive cost, space and weight.

The Power-Wedge Cog-Belt is now made of EPDM (Ethylene Propylene Diene Monomer), a synthetic rubber with outstanding properties. The raw-edge construction contributes to outstanding operating efficiency. More torque with little or no slippage. The result is savings — in time, in belt life and in energy costs.

Round belts are a high performance solution for conveyors, quarter-turn, twisted, and serpentine drives. Our round belts feature a no-splice construction for added durability with minimal stretch for minimum take-up requirements.

  • Better belt stability and fewer take-up adjustments

  • No splice for added durability.

  • Conveyors, commercial sewing machines, quarter-turn drives, twisted drives, serpentine drives and more

  • 7/16" and 9/16" diameters from 70" to 762"

Wedge-Band is the banded version of the hard-working Super Power-Wedge v-belt. Wedge-Band is an excellent choice for virtually any application where increased horsepower capacity and output is needed, or where conventional multiple belt drives are impractical because of space or weight limitations. The specially compounded wrapped construction is ideal for clutching operations. Banded v-belts are ideally suited for pulsating or heavily shock loaded drives and drives with extremely long center distances. Wedge-Band is oil and heat resistant, static dissipating, and it won’t turn over or jump off the drive.

Features/Advantages

  • Prevents belt whip and rollover on long center distance drives

  • Smoother clutching

  • Space and weight saver

  • Oversized polyester cord provides added belt strength and stability

  • Cord is chemically treated for resistance to belt stretch

  • Tie-band is highly engineered to permanently bond multiple belts together enabling the belts to function as a single unit with even load distribution and wear

  • Vibration is dampened

  • Heavy shock loads are absorbed

Applications

  • Mud pumps, rock crushers, stump grinders, and more

Sizes

  • R3V, R5V and R8V cross-sections from 34" to 601"

Specially formulated fiber-loaded EPDM rubber compounds, engineered fabrics and high-modulus polyester cord offer greater strength, longer life, better heat dissipation and higher efficiencies than best-in-class wrapped v-belts. The unique CNA (central neutral axis) cord placement positions the strength of the belt lower on the pulleys to maintain stability and prevent roll-over. The raw edge construction results in more efficient power transmission and reduced energy loss.

Features/Advantages

  • Higher performance alternative to classical wrapped v-belts
  • More energy efficient than wrapped v-belts
  • Unique design for longer life
  • Less maintenance and downtime
  • EPDM rubber compound is static conductive, resistant to hardening and glazing, and operates in a broad temperature range (-50ºF to +250ºF)
  • Backed by our Iron Clad Guarantee
  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Shaker screens, debarkers, industrial washers and dryers, and more

Sizes

  • A, B and C cross-sections from 17" to 144"

Vee-Rib belts are ideally suited for high speed drives where conventional v-belts cannot operate. The Vee-Rib belt provides smooth, vibration-free performance in a compact drive.   • Maximum flexibility

  • High horsepower

  • Abrasion resistant

The Super Vee-Band belt is an ideal choice on classical drives where individual v-belts tend to roll over or whip severely on the drive due to fluctuating load conditions or harsh drive vibration. The individual ribs are permanently joined together at the top with a reinforced fabric tie-band preventing the individual belts from coming off the drive.

Features/Advantages

  • Prevents belt whip and rollover on long center distance drives

  • Tie-Band is highly engineered to permanently bond multiple belts together enabling the belts to function as a single unit with even load distribution and wear

  • Excellent oil and heat resistance, static dissipating

  • Vibration is dampened

  • Heavy shock loads are absorbed

Applications

  • Rock crushers, vibrating equipment, saws, pumps, and more

Sizes

  • RBP, RCP and RDP cross-sections from 39" to 663"

Round belts are a high performance solution for conveyors, quarter-turn, twisted, and serpentine drives. Our round belts feature a no-splice construction for added durability with minimal stretch for minimum take-up requirements.

Features/Advantages

  • Heavy duty stress-relieved fabric cover flexes better for improved belt life

  • Hi-modulus cords carry horsepower loads with minimum stretch

  • Better belt stability and fewer take-up adjustments

  • Compression section provides uniform cord support and improves belt flex life

  • No splice for added durability.

Applications

  • Conveyors, commercial sewing machines, quarter-turn drives, twisted drives, serpentine drives and more

Sizes

  • 7/16" and 9/16" diameters from 70" to 762"

The finest wrapped belt in the industry and workhorse of classical V-belts. Super Blue Ribbon v-belts assure dependable length stability and require less re-tensioning and take-up. The cord is coated with a special compound that produces a secure, long-lasting bond with the surrounding rubber. The heavy-duty fabric cover protects the core. Its extra flexibility permits the belt to bend more easily around the smallest pulleys with less strain on the fabric. Longer belt life results in less frequent replacement, less downtime and lower maintenance costs.

Features/Advantages

  • Dependable performance on classical belt drives
  • Heavy duty cover is impregnated with oil and heat resistant rubber
  • Resists flex fatigue
  • Longer belt life
  • Smoother running
  • Backed by our Iron Clad Guarantee
  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Mixers, pumps, conveyors, any and everything, and more

Sizes

  • AP, BP, CP, DP, EP cross-sections from 22" to 664"

More Grip. Less Slip. The Metric Power-Wedge Cog-Belt combines the advantages of the narrow wedge design with raw edge performance for maximum operating efficiency in a compact drive package. The narrow profile permits reduced drive widths and a smaller drive envelope. Higher horsepower ratings translate into greater design flexibility — reducing drive cost, space and weight.

The Power-Wedge Cog-Belt is now made of EPDM (Ethylene Propylene Diene Monomer), a synthetic rubber with outstanding properties. The raw-edge construction contributes to outstanding operating efficiency. More torque with little or no slippage. The result is savings — in time, in belt life and in energy costs.

Features/Advantages

  • High horsepower ratings

  • Design flexibility

  • Longer belt life

  • Durable                                                                         

  • Oil and heat resistant

  • Static conductive

  • Resists hardening and glazing

  • Broad operating temperature range (-50°F to +250°F)

  • Smoother running

  • Energy efficient

  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Drives that require metric cross sections on industrial machinery, fans, pumps, and more

Sizes

  • Available in SPZX, SPAX, SPBX, and SPCX cross sections from 643mm to 5092mm. Also available in 3VX, 5VX, and 8VX imperial sizes. Where applicable, belts are dual branded with imperial and metric part numbers.

Vee-Rib belts are ideally suited for high speed drives where conventional v-belts cannot operate. The Vee-Rib belt provides smooth, vibration-free performance in a compact drive. The special “truncated” rib design enhances belt flexibility and resists cracking better than non-truncated v-ribbed belts. Vee-Rib is resistant to oil, heat and abrasion for longer belt life.

Features/Advantages

  • Vibration-free

  • Heat resistant

  • Maximum flexibility

  • High horsepower

  • Abrasion resistant

Applications

  • Industrial dryers, fitness equipment, machine tools, high speed blowers, and more

Sizes

  • J cross-section from 13" to 98"

The Problem Solver! Super II v-belts are the solution to the constant and costly problem of replacing ordinary v-belts on troublesome drives. Specially formulated fiber-loaded EPDM rubber compounds, engineered fabrics and high-modulus polyester cord offer greater strength, longer life, better heat dissipation and higher efficiencies than best-in-class wrapped v-belts. The unique CNA (central neutral axis) cord placement positions the strength of the belt lower on the pulleys to maintain stability and prevent roll-over. The raw edge construction results in more efficient power transmission and reduced energy loss.

Features/Advantages

  • Higher performance alternative to classical wrapped v-belts
  • More energy efficient than wrapped v-belts
  • Unique design for longer life
  • Less maintenance and downtime
  • EPDM rubber compound is static conductive, resistant to hardening and glazing, and operates in a broad temperature range (-50ºF to +250ºF)
  • Backed by our Iron Clad Guarantee
  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Shaker screens, debarkers, industrial washers and dryers, and more

Sizes

  • A, B and C cross-sections from 17" to 144"

Reduce Downtime and Save

For superior performance and energy savings you can count on Carlisle belts by Timken.

More Grip. Less Slip. The Metric Power-Wedge Cog-Belt combines the advantages of the narrow wedge design with raw edge performance for maximum operating efficiency in a compact drive package. The narrow profile permits reduced drive widths and a smaller drive envelope. Higher horsepower ratings translate into greater design flexibility — reducing drive cost, space and weight.

The Power-Wedge Cog-Belt is now made of EPDM (Ethylene Propylene Diene Monomer), a synthetic rubber with outstanding properties. The raw-edge construction contributes to outstanding operating efficiency. More torque with little or no slippage. The result is savings — in time, in belt life and in energy costs.

Features/Advantages

  • High horsepower ratings

  • Design flexibility

  • Longer belt life

  • Durable                                                                         

  • Oil and heat resistant

  • Static conductive

  • Resists hardening and glazing

  • Broad operating temperature range (-50°F to +250°F)

  • Smoother running

  • Energy efficient

  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Drives that require metric cross sections on industrial machinery, fans, pumps, and more

Sizes

  • Available in SPZX, SPAX, SPBX, and SPCX cross sections from 643mm to 5092mm. Also available in 3VX, 5VX, and 8VX imperial sizes. Where applicable, belts are dual branded with imperial and metric part numbers.

Round belts are a high performance solution for conveyors, quarter-turn, twisted, and serpentine drives. Our round belts feature a no-splice construction for added durability with minimal stretch for minimum take-up requirements.

Features/Advantages

  • Heavy duty stress-relieved fabric cover flexes better for improved belt life

  • Hi-modulus cords carry horsepower loads with minimum stretch

  • Better belt stability and fewer take-up adjustments

  • Compression section provides uniform cord support and improves belt flex life

  • No splice for added durability.

Applications

  • Conveyors, commercial sewing machines, quarter-turn drives, twisted drives, serpentine drives and more

Sizes

  • 7/16" and 9/16" diameters from 70" to 762"

The finest wrapped belt in the industry and workhorse of classical V-belts. Super Blue Ribbon v-belts assure dependable length stability and require less re-tensioning and take-up. The cord is coated with a special compound that produces a secure, long-lasting bond with the surrounding rubber. The heavy-duty fabric cover protects the core. Its extra flexibility permits the belt to bend more easily around the smallest pulleys with less strain on the fabric. Longer belt life results in less frequent replacement, less downtime and lower maintenance costs.

Features/Advantages

  • Dependable performance on classical belt drives
  • Heavy duty cover is impregnated with oil and heat resistant rubber
  • Resists flex fatigue
  • Longer belt life
  • Smoother running
  • Backed by our Iron Clad Guarantee
  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Mixers, pumps, conveyors, any and everything, and more

Sizes

  • AP, BP, CP, DP, EP cross-sections from 22" to 664"

Timken Belts is a leader in variable speed belt technology. For use with industrial variable speed pulleys to gain a wide range of driven speeds. Raw edge sidewalls improve gripping action. Unitized belt bonding and specially formulated rubber compounds provide superior resistance to aging caused by wear, oil, heat, and harmful environmental factors. The Variable Speed Cog-Belt has been engineered to the same high standards that Timken Belts uses to produce belts for original equipment manufacturers (OEMs).

Features/Advantages

  • Wide selection of sizes

  • Static dissipating

Applications

  • For snowmobile and ATV variable speed belts click here

Sizes

Wedge-Band is the banded version of the hard-working Super Power-Wedge v-belt. Wedge-Band is an excellent choice for virtually any application where increased horsepower capacity and output is needed, or where conventional multiple belt drives are impractical because of space or weight limitations. The specially compounded wrapped construction is ideal for clutching operations. Banded v-belts are ideally suited for pulsating or heavily shock loaded drives and drives with extremely long center distances. Wedge-Band is oil and heat resistant, static dissipating, and it won’t turn over or jump off the drive.

Features/Advantages

  • Prevents belt whip and rollover on long center distance drives

  • Smoother clutching

  • Space and weight saver

  • Oversized polyester cord provides added belt strength and stability

  • Cord is chemically treated for resistance to belt stretch

  • Tie-band is highly engineered to permanently bond multiple belts together enabling the belts to function as a single unit with even load distribution and wear

  • Vibration is dampened

  • Heavy shock loads are absorbed

Applications

  • Mud pumps, rock crushers, stump grinders, and more

Sizes

  • R3V, R5V and R8V cross-sections from 34" to 601"

The Problem Solver! Super II v-belts are the solution to the constant and costly problem of replacing ordinary v-belts on troublesome drives. Specially formulated fiber-loaded EPDM rubber compounds, engineered fabrics and high-modulus polyester cord offer greater strength, longer life, better heat dissipation and higher efficiencies than best-in-class wrapped v-belts. The unique CNA (central neutral axis) cord placement positions the strength of the belt lower on the pulleys to maintain stability and prevent roll-over. The raw edge construction results in more efficient power transmission and reduced energy loss.

Features/Advantages

  • Higher performance alternative to classical wrapped v-belts
  • More energy efficient than wrapped v-belts
  • Unique design for longer life
  • Less maintenance and downtime
  • EPDM rubber compound is static conductive, resistant to hardening and glazing, and operates in a broad temperature range (-50ºF to +250ºF)
  • Backed by our Iron Clad Guarantee
  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Shaker screens, debarkers, industrial washers and dryers, and more

Sizes

  • A, B and C cross-sections from 17" to 144"

The original deep-groove notched design is specifically developed for double angle “CC” drives commonly found in the demanding textile industry. The deep groove prevents belt rollover while the notches provide added flexibility and longer life.

Features/Advantages

  • Multiple ply fabric cord provides superior strength and durability

  • Strong yet flexible for power transmission from both sides of the belt

  • Resistant to oil and heat

  • Static conductive

Applications

  • Drives with long center, serpentine applications usually found in the textile industry

NOTE: Dry Can belts are normally used as a single belt on a drive and matching is not required. When ordering two or more Dry Can belts to be used as a matched set on the same drive, please specify that the belts must be a matched set.

Sizes

  • Cross-section from 212" to 902"

The finest wrapped belt in the industry and workhorse of classical V-belts. Super Blue Ribbon v-belts assure dependable length stability and require less re-tensioning and take-up. The cord is coated with a special compound that produces a secure, long-lasting bond with the surrounding rubber. The heavy-duty fabric cover protects the core. Its extra flexibility permits the belt to bend more easily around the smallest pulleys with less strain on the fabric. Longer belt life results in less frequent replacement, less downtime and lower maintenance costs.

  • Dependable performance on classical belt drives
  • Heavy duty cover is impregnated with oil and heat resistant rubber

More Grip. Less Slip. The Metric Power-Wedge Cog-Belt combines the advantages of the narrow wedge design with raw edge performance for maximum operating efficiency in a compact drive package. The narrow profile permits reduced drive widths and a smaller drive envelope. Higher horsepower ratings translate into greater design flexibility — reducing drive cost, space and weight.

The Power-Wedge Cog-Belt is now made of EPDM (Ethylene Propylene Diene Monomer), a synthetic rubber with outstanding properties. The raw-edge construction contributes to outstanding operating efficiency. More torque with little or no slippage. The result is savings — in time, in belt life and in energy costs.

Features/Advantages

  • High horsepower ratings

  • Design flexibility

  • Longer belt life

  • Durable                                                                         

  • Oil and heat resistant

  • Static conductive

  • Resists hardening and glazing

  • Broad operating temperature range (-50°F to +250°F)

  • Smoother running

  • Energy efficient

  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

The Super Vee-Band belt is an ideal choice on classical drives where individual v-belts tend to roll over or whip severely on the drive due to fluctuating load conditions or harsh drive vibration. The individual ribs are permanently joined together at the top with a reinforced fabric tie-band preventing the individual belts from coming off the drive.

Features/Advantages

  • Prevents belt whip and rollover on long center distance drives

  • Tie-Band is highly engineered to permanently bond multiple belts together enabling the belts to function as a single unit with even load distribution and wear

  • Excellent oil and heat resistance, static dissipating

  • Vibration is dampened

  • Heavy shock loads are absorbed

Applications

  • Rock crushers, vibrating equipment, saws, pumps, and more

Sizes

  • RBP, RCP and RDP cross-sections from 39" to 663"

The Variable Speed Cog-Belt has been engineered to the same high standards that Timken Belts uses to produce belts for original equipment manufacturers (OEMs).

Round belts are a high performance solution for conveyors, quarter-turn, twisted, and serpentine drives. Our round belts feature a no-splice construction for added durability with minimal stretch for minimum take-up requirements.

Features/Advantages

  • Heavy duty stress-relieved fabric cover flexes better for improved belt life

  • Hi-modulus cords carry horsepower loads with minimum stretch

  • Better belt stability and fewer take-up adjustments

  • Compression section provides uniform cord support and improves belt flex life

  • No splice for added durability.

Applications

  • Conveyors, commercial sewing machines, quarter-turn drives, twisted drives, serpentine drives and more

Sizes

  • 7/16" and 9/16" diameters from 70" to 762"

The Problem Solver! Super II v-belts are the solution to the constant and costly problem of replacing ordinary v-belts on troublesome drives. Specially formulated fiber-loaded EPDM rubber compounds, engineered fabrics and high-modulus polyester cord offer greater strength, longer life, better heat dissipation and higher efficiencies than best-in-class wrapped v-belts. The unique CNA (central neutral axis) cord placement positions the strength of the belt lower on the pulleys to maintain stability and prevent roll-over. The raw edge construction results in more efficient power transmission and reduced energy loss.

Features/Advantages

  • Higher performance alternative to classical wrapped v-belts
  • More energy efficient than wrapped v-belts
  • Unique design for longer life
  • Less maintenance and downtime
  • EPDM rubber compound is static conductive, resistant to hardening and glazing, and operates in a broad temperature range (-50ºF to +250ºF)
  • Backed by our Iron Clad Guarantee
  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Shaker screens, debarkers, industrial washers and dryers, and more

Sizes

  • A, B and C cross-sections from 17" to 144"

Wedge-Band is the banded version of the hard-working Super Power-Wedge v-belt. Wedge-Band is an excellent choice for virtually any application where increased horsepower capacity and output is needed, or where conventional multiple belt drives are impractical because of space or weight limitations. The specially compounded wrapped construction is ideal for clutching operations. Banded v-belts are ideally suited for pulsating or heavily shock loaded drives and drives with extremely long center distances. Wedge-Band is oil and heat resistant, static dissipating, and it won’t turn over or jump off the drive.

Features/Advantages

  • Prevents belt whip and rollover on long center distance drives

  • Smoother clutching

  • Space and weight saver

  • Oversized polyester cord provides added belt strength and stability

  • Cord is chemically treated for resistance to belt stretch

  • Tie-band is highly engineered to permanently bond multiple belts together enabling the belts to function as a single unit with even load distribution and wear

  • Vibration is dampened

  • Heavy shock loads are absorbed

Applications

  • Mud pumps, rock crushers, stump grinders, and more

Sizes

  • R3V, R5V and R8V cross-sections from 34" to 601"

The Problem Solver! Super II v-belts are the solution to the constant and costly problem of replacing ordinary v-belts on troublesome drives. Specially formulated fiber-loaded EPDM rubber compounds, engineered fabrics and high-modulus polyester cord offer greater strength, longer life, better heat dissipation and higher efficiencies than best-in-class wrapped v-belts. The unique CNA (central neutral axis) cord placement positions the strength of the belt lower on the pulleys to maintain stability and prevent roll-over. Round belts are a high performance solution for conveyors, quarter-turn, twisted, and serpentine drives. Our round belts feature a no-splice construction for added durability with minimal stretch for minimum take-up requirements.

Features/Advantages

  • Heavy duty stress-relieved fabric cover flexes better for improved belt life

  • Hi-modulus cords carry horsepower loads with minimum stretch

  • Better belt stability and fewer take-up adjustments

  • Compression section provides uniform cord support and improves belt flex life

  • No splice for added durability.

Applications

  • Conveyors, commercial sewing machines, quarter-turn drives, twisted drives, serpentine drives and more

Sizes

  • 7/16" and 9/16" diameters from 70" to 762"

More Grip. Less Slip. The Metric Power-Wedge Cog-Belt combines the advantages of the narrow wedge design with raw edge performance for maximum operating efficiency in a compact drive package. The narrow profile permits reduced drive widths and a smaller drive envelope. Higher horsepower ratings translate into greater design flexibility — reducing drive cost, space and weight.

The Power-Wedge Cog-Belt is now made of EPDM (Ethylene Propylene Diene Monomer), a synthetic rubber with outstanding properties. The raw-edge construction contributes to outstanding operating efficiency. More torque with little or no slippage. The result is savings — in time, in belt life and in energy costs.

Features/Advantages

  • High horsepower ratings

  • Design flexibility

  • Longer belt life

  • Durable                                                                         

  • Oil and heat resistant

  • Static conductive

  • Resists hardening and glazing

  • Broad operating temperature range (-50°F to +250°F)

  • Smoother running

  • Energy efficient

  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Drives that require metric cross sections on industrial machinery, fans, pumps, and more

Sizes

  • Available in SPZX, SPAX, SPBX, and SPCX cross sections from 643mm to 5092mm. Also available in 3VX, 5VX, and 8VX imperial sizes. Where applicable, belts are dual branded with imperial and metric part numbers.

Wedge-Band is the banded version of the hard-working Super Power-Wedge v-belt. Wedge-Band is an excellent choice for virtually any application where increased horsepower capacity and output is needed, or where conventional multiple belt drives are impractical because of space or weight limitations. The specially compounded wrapped construction is ideal for clutching operations. Banded v-belts are ideally suited for pulsating or heavily shock loaded drives and drives with extremely long center distances. Wedge-Band is oil and heat resistant, static dissipating, and it won’t turn over or jump off the drive.

Features/Advantages

  • Prevents belt whip and rollover on long center distance drives

  • Smoother clutching

  • Space and weight saver

  • Oversized polyester cord provides added belt strength and stability

  • Cord is chemically treated for resistance to belt stretch

  • Tie-band is highly engineered to permanently bond multiple belts together enabling the belts to function as a single unit with even load distribution and wear

  • Vibration is dampened

  • Heavy shock loads are absorbed

Applications

  • Mud pumps, rock crushers, stump grinders, and more

Sizes

  • R3V, R5V and R8V cross-sections from 34" to 601"

The finest wrapped belt in the industry and workhorse of classical V-belts. Super Blue Ribbon v-belts assure dependable length stability and require less re-tensioning and take-up. The cord is coated with a special compound that produces a secure, long-lasting bond with the surrounding rubber. The heavy-duty fabric cover protects the core. Its extra flexibility permits the belt to bend more easily around the smallest pulleys with less strain on the fabric. Longer belt life results in less frequent replacement, less downtime and lower maintenance costs.

The Problem Solver! Super II v-belts are the solution to the constant and costly problem of replacing ordinary v-belts on troublesome drives. Specially formulated fiber-loaded EPDM rubber compounds, engineered fabrics and high-modulus polyester cord offer greater strength, longer life, better heat dissipation and higher efficiencies than best-in-class wrapped v-belts. The unique CNA (central neutral axis) cord placement positions the strength of the belt lower on the pulleys to maintain stability and prevent roll-over. The raw edge construction results in more efficient power transmission and reduced energy loss.

Features/Advantages

  • Higher performance alternative to classical wrapped v-belts
  • More energy efficient than wrapped v-belts
  • Unique design for longer life
  • Less maintenance and downtime
  • EPDM rubber compound is static conductive, resistant to hardening and glazing, and operates in a broad temperature range (-50ºF to +250ºF)
  • Backed by our Iron Clad Guarantee
  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Shaker screens, debarkers, industrial washers and dryers, and more

Sizes

  • A, B and C cross-sections from 17" to 144"

Wedge-Band is the banded version of the hard-working Super Power-Wedge v-belt. Wedge-Band is an excellent choice for virtually any application where increased horsepower capacity and output is needed, or where conventional multiple belt drives are impractical because of space or weight limitations. The specially compounded wrapped construction is ideal for clutching operations. Banded v-belts are ideally suited for pulsating or heavily shock loaded drives and drives with extremely long center distances. Wedge-Band is oil and heat resistant, static dissipating, and it won’t turn over or jump off the drive.

Features/Advantages

  • Prevents belt whip and rollover on long center distance drives

  • Smoother clutching

  • Space and weight saver

  • Oversized polyester cord provides added belt strength and stability

  • Cord is chemically treated for resistance to belt stretch

  • Tie-band is highly engineered to permanently bond multiple belts together enabling the belts to function as a single unit with even load distribution and wear

  • Vibration is dampened

  • Heavy shock loads are absorbed

Applications

  • Mud pumps, rock crushers, stump grinders, and more

Sizes

  • R3V, R5V and R8V cross-sections from 34" to 601"

The Super Vee-Band belt is an ideal choice on classical drives where individual v-belts tend to roll over or whip severely on the drive due to fluctuating load conditions or harsh drive vibration. The individual ribs are permanently joined together at the top with a reinforced fabric tie-band preventing the individual belts from coming off the drive.

Features/Advantages

  • Prevents belt whip and rollover on long center distance drives

  • Tie-Band is highly engineered to permanently bond multiple belts together enabling the belts to function as a single unit with even load distribution and wear

  • Excellent oil and heat resistance, static dissipating

  • Vibration is dampened

  • Heavy shock loads are absorbed

Applications

  • Rock crushers, vibrating equipment, saws, pumps, and more

Sizes

  • RBP, RCP and RDP cross-sections from 39" to 663"

More Grip. Less Slip. The Metric Power-Wedge Cog-Belt combines the advantages of the narrow wedge design with raw edge performance for maximum operating efficiency in a compact drive package. The narrow profile permits reduced drive widths and a smaller drive envelope. Higher horsepower ratings translate into greater design flexibility — reducing drive cost, space and weight.

The Power-Wedge Cog-Belt is now made of EPDM (Ethylene Propylene Diene Monomer), a synthetic rubber with outstanding properties. The raw-edge construction contributes to outstanding operating efficiency. More torque with little or no slippage. The result is savings — in time, in belt life and in energy costs.

Features/Advantages

  • High horsepower ratings

  • Design flexibility

  • Longer belt life

  • Durable                                                                         

  • Oil and heat resistant

  • Static conductive

  • Resists hardening and glazing

  • Broad operating temperature range (-50°F to +250°F)

  • Smoother running

  • Energy efficient

  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Drives that require metric cross sections on industrial machinery, fans, pumps, and more

Sizes

  • Available in SPZX, SPAX, SPBX, and SPCX cross sections from 643mm to 5092mm. Also available in 3VX, 5VX, and 8VX imperial sizes. Where applicable, belts are dual branded with imperial and metric part numbers.

The original deep-groove notched design is specifically developed for double angle “CC” drives commonly found in the demanding textile industry. The deep groove prevents belt rollover while the notches provide added flexibility and longer life.

Specially formulated fiber-loaded EPDM rubber compounds, engineered fabrics and high-modulus polyester cord offer greater strength, longer life, better heat dissipation and higher efficiencies than best-in-class wrapped v-belts. The unique CNA (central neutral axis) cord placement positions the strength of the belt lower on the pulleys to maintain stability and prevent roll-over. The raw edge construction results in more efficient power transmission and reduced energy loss.

Features/Advantages

  • Higher performance alternative to classical wrapped v-belts
  • More energy efficient than wrapped v-belts
  • Unique design for longer life
  • Less maintenance and downtime
  • EPDM rubber compound is static conductive, resistant to hardening and glazing, and operates in a broad temperature range (-50ºF to +250ºF)
  • Backed by our Iron Clad Guarantee
  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Shaker screens, debarkers, industrial washers and dryers, and more

Sizes

  • A, B and C cross-sections from 17" to 144"

More Grip. Less Slip. The Metric Power-Wedge Cog-Belt combines the advantages of the narrow wedge design with raw edge performance for maximum operating efficiency in a compact drive package. The narrow profile permits reduced drive widths and a smaller drive envelope. Higher horsepower ratings translate into greater design flexibility — reducing drive cost, space and weight.

The Power-Wedge Cog-Belt is now made of EPDM (Ethylene Propylene Diene Monomer), a synthetic rubber with outstanding properties. The raw-edge construction contributes to outstanding operating efficiency. More torque with little or no slippage. The result is savings — in time, in belt life and in energy costs.

Features/Advantages

  • High horsepower ratings

  • Design flexibility

  • Longer belt life

  • Durable                                                                         

  • Oil and heat resistant

  • Static conductive

  • Resists hardening and glazing

  • Broad operating temperature range (-50°F to +250°F)

  • Smoother running

  • Energy efficient

  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Drives that require metric cross sections on industrial machinery, fans, pumps, and more

Sizes

  • Available in SPZX, SPAX, SPBX, and SPCX cross sections from 643mm to 5092mm. Also available in 3VX, 5VX, and 8VX imperial sizes. Where applicable, belts are dual branded with imperial and metric part numbers.

Wedge-Band is the banded version of the hard-working Super Power-Wedge v-belt. Wedge-Band is an excellent choice for virtually any application where increased horsepower capacity and output is needed, or where conventional multiple belt drives are impractical because of space or weight limitations. The specially compounded wrapped construction is ideal for clutching operations. Banded v-belts are ideally suited for pulsating or heavily shock loaded drives and drives with extremely long center distances. Wedge-Band is oil and heat resistant, static dissipating, and it won’t turn over or jump off the drive.

Features/Advantages

  • Prevents belt whip and rollover on long center distance drives

  • Smoother clutching

  • Space and weight saver

  • Oversized polyester cord provides added belt strength and stability

  • Cord is chemically treated for resistance to belt stretch

  • Tie-band is highly engineered to permanently bond multiple belts together enabling the belts to function as a single unit with even load distribution and wear

  • Vibration is dampened

  • Heavy shock loads are absorbed

Applications

  • Mud pumps, rock crushers, stump grinders, and more

Sizes

  • R3V, R5V and R8V cross-sections from 34" to 601"

Round belts are a high performance solution for conveyors, quarter-turn, twisted, and serpentine drives. Our round belts feature a no-splice construction for added durability with minimal stretch for minimum take-up requirements.

Features/Advantages

  • Heavy duty stress-relieved fabric cover flexes better for improved belt life

  • Hi-modulus cords carry horsepower loads with minimum stretch

  • Better belt stability and fewer take-up adjustments

  • Compression section provides uniform cord support and improves belt flex life

  • No splice for added durability.

Applications

  • Conveyors, commercial sewing machines, quarter-turn drives, twisted drives, serpentine drives and more

Sizes

  • 7/16" and 9/16" diameters from 70" to 762"

The finest wrapped belt in the industry and workhorse of classical V-belts. Super Blue Ribbon v-belts assure dependable length stability and require less re-tensioning and take-up. The cord is coated with a special compound that produces a secure, long-lasting bond with the surrounding rubber. The heavy-duty fabric cover protects the core. Its extra flexibility permits the belt to bend more easily around the smallest pulleys with less strain on the fabric. Longer belt life results in less frequent replacement, less downtime and lower maintenance costs.

Features/Advantages

  • Dependable performance on classical belt drives
  • Heavy duty cover is impregnated with oil and heat resistant rubber
  • Resists flex fatigue
  • Longer belt life
  • Smoother running
  • Backed by our Iron Clad Guarantee
  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Mixers, pumps, conveyors, any and everything, and more

Sizes

  • AP, BP, CP, DP, EP cross-sections from 22" to 664"

More Grip. Less Slip. The Metric Power-Wedge Cog-Belt combines the advantages of the narrow wedge design with raw edge performance for maximum operating efficiency in a compact drive package. The narrow profile permits reduced drive widths and a smaller drive envelope. Higher horsepower ratings translate into greater design flexibility — reducing drive cost, space and weight.

The Power-Wedge Cog-Belt is now made of EPDM (Ethylene Propylene Diene Monomer), a synthetic rubber with outstanding properties. The raw-edge construction contributes to outstanding operating efficiency. More torque with little or no slippage. The result is savings — in time, in belt life and in energy costs.

Features/Advantages

  • High horsepower ratings

  • Design flexibility

  • Longer belt life

  • Durable                                                                         

  • Oil and heat resistant

  • Static conductive

  • Resists hardening and glazing

  • Broad operating temperature range (-50°F to +250°F)

  • Smoother running

  • Energy efficient

  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Drives that require metric cross sections on industrial machinery, fans, pumps, and more

The Problem Solver! Super II v-belts are the solution to the constant and costly problem of replacing ordinary v-belts on troublesome drives. Specially formulated fiber-loaded EPDM rubber compounds, engineered fabrics and high-modulus polyester cord offer greater strength, longer life, better heat dissipation and higher efficiencies than best-in-class wrapped v-belts. The unique CNA (central neutral axis) cord placement positions the strength of the belt lower on the pulleys to maintain stability and prevent roll-over. The raw edge construction results in more efficient power transmission and reduced energy loss.

Features/Advantages

  • Higher performance alternative to classical wrapped v-belts
  • More energy efficient than wrapped v-belts
  • Unique design for longer life
  • Less maintenance and downtime
  • EPDM rubber compound is static conductive, resistant to hardening and glazing, and operates in a broad temperature range (-50ºF to +250ºF)
  • Backed by our Iron Clad Guarantee
  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Shaker screens, debarkers, industrial washers and dryers, and more

Sizes

  • A, B and C cross-sections from 17" to 144"

Wedge-Band is the banded version of the hard-working Super Power-Wedge v-belt. Wedge-Band is an excellent choice for virtually any application where increased horsepower capacity and output is needed, or where conventional multiple belt drives are impractical because of space or weight limitations. The specially compounded wrapped construction is ideal for clutching operations. Banded v-belts are ideally suited for pulsating or heavily shock loaded drives and drives with extremely long center distances. Wedge-Band is oil and heat resistant, static dissipating, and it won’t turn over or jump off the drive.

Features/Advantages

  • Prevents belt whip and rollover on long center distance drives

  • Smoother clutching

  • Space and weight saver

  • Oversized polyester cord provides added belt strength and stability

  • Cord is chemically treated for resistance to belt stretch

  • Tie-band is highly engineered to permanently bond multiple belts together enabling the belts to function as a single unit with even load distribution and wear

  • Vibration is dampened

  • Heavy shock loads are absorbed

Applications

  • Mud pumps, rock crushers, stump grinders, and more

Sizes

  • R3V, R5V and R8V cross-sections from 34" to 601"

Specially formulated fiber-loaded EPDM rubber compounds, engineered fabrics and high-modulus polyester cord offer greater strength, longer life, better heat dissipation and higher efficiencies than best-in-class wrapped v-belts. The unique CNA (central neutral axis) cord placement positions the strength of the belt lower on the pulleys to maintain stability and prevent roll-over. The raw edge construction results in more efficient power transmission and reduced energy loss.

Features/Advantages

  • Higher performance alternative to classical wrapped v-belts
  • More energy efficient than wrapped v-belts
  • Unique design for longer life
  • Less maintenance and downtime
  • EPDM rubber compound is static conductive, resistant to hardening and glazing, and operates in a broad temperature range (-50ºF to +250ºF)
  • Backed by our Iron Clad Guarantee
  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Shaker screens, debarkers, industrial washers and dryers, and more

Sizes

  • A, B and C cross-sections from 17" to 144"

The finest wrapped belt in the industry and workhorse of classical V-belts. Super Blue Ribbon v-belts assure dependable length stability and require less re-tensioning and take-up. More Grip. Less Slip. The Metric Power-Wedge Cog-Belt combines the advantages of the narrow wedge design with raw edge performance for maximum operating efficiency in a compact drive package. The narrow profile permits reduced drive widths and a smaller drive envelope. Higher horsepower ratings translate into greater design flexibility — reducing drive cost, space and weight.

The Power-Wedge Cog-Belt is now made of EPDM (Ethylene Propylene Diene Monomer), a synthetic rubber with outstanding properties. The raw-edge construction contributes to outstanding operating efficiency. More torque with little or no slippage. The result is savings — in time, in belt life and in energy costs.

Features/Advantages

  • High horsepower ratings

  • Design flexibility

  • Longer belt life

  • Durable                                                                         

  • Oil and heat resistant

  • Static conductive

  • Resists hardening and glazing

  • Broad operating temperature range (-50°F to +250°F)

  • Smoother running

  • Energy efficient

  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Drives that require metric cross sections on industrial machinery, fans, pumps, and more

Sizes

  • Available in SPZX, SPAX, SPBX, and SPCX cross sections from 643mm to 5092mm. Also available in 3VX, 5VX, and 8VX imperial sizes. Where applicable, belts are dual branded with imperial and metric part numbers.

Round belts are a high performance solution for conveyors, quarter-turn, twisted, and serpentine drives. Our round belts feature a no-splice construction for added durability with minimal stretch for minimum take-up requirements.

  • Better belt stability and fewer take-up adjustments

Vee-Rib belts are ideally suited for high speed drives where conventional v-belts cannot operate. The Vee-Rib belt provides smooth, vibration-free performance in a compact drive.   • High horsepower

The finest wrapped belt in the industry and workhorse of classical V-belts. Super Blue Ribbon v-belts assure dependable length stability and require less re-tensioning and take-up. Round belts are a high performance solution for conveyors, quarter-turn, twisted, and serpentine drives. Our round belts feature a no-splice construction for added durability with minimal stretch for minimum take-up requirements.

  • No splice for added durability.

  • Conveyors, commercial sewing machines, quarter-turn drives, twisted drives, serpentine drives and more

  • 7/16" and 9/16" diameters from 70" to 762"

The Problem Solver! Super II v-belts are the solution to the constant and costly problem of replacing ordinary v-belts on troublesome drives. Specially formulated fiber-loaded EPDM rubber compounds, engineered fabrics and high-modulus polyester cord offer greater strength, longer life, better heat dissipation and higher efficiencies than best-in-class wrapped v-belts. The unique CNA (central neutral axis) cord placement positions the strength of the belt lower on the pulleys to maintain stability and prevent roll-over. The raw edge construction results in more efficient power transmission and reduced energy loss.

Features/Advantages

  • Higher performance alternative to classical wrapped v-belts
  • More energy efficient than wrapped v-belts
  • Unique design for longer life
  • Less maintenance and downtime
  • EPDM rubber compound is static conductive, resistant to hardening and glazing, and operates in a broad temperature range (-50ºF to +250ºF)
  • Backed by our Iron Clad Guarantee
  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Shaker screens, debarkers, industrial washers and dryers, and more

Sizes

  • A, B and C cross-sections from 17" to 144"

The finest wrapped belt in the industry and workhorse of classical V-belts. Super Blue Ribbon v-belts assure dependable length stability and require less re-tensioning and take-up. The cord is coated with a special compound that produces a secure, long-lasting bond with the surrounding rubber. The heavy-duty fabric cover protects the core. Its extra flexibility permits the belt to bend more easily around the smallest pulleys with less strain on the fabric. Longer belt life results in less frequent replacement, less downtime and lower maintenance costs.

The narrow profile permits reduced drive widths and a smaller drive envelope. Higher horsepower ratings translate into greater design flexibility — reducing drive cost, space and weight.

The Power-Wedge Cog-Belt is now made of EPDM (Ethylene Propylene Diene Monomer), a synthetic rubber with outstanding properties. The raw-edge construction contributes to outstanding operating efficiency. More torque with little or no slippage. The result is savings — in time, in belt life and in energy costs.

The Problem Solver! Super II v-belts are the solution to the constant and costly problem of replacing ordinary v-belts on troublesome drives. Specially formulated fiber-loaded EPDM rubber compounds, engineered fabrics and high-modulus polyester cord offer greater strength, longer life, better heat dissipation and higher efficiencies than best-in-class wrapped v-belts. The unique CNA (central neutral axis) cord placement positions the strength of the belt lower on the pulleys to maintain stability and prevent roll-over. The raw edge construction results in more efficient power transmission and reduced energy loss.

Features/Advantages

  • Higher performance alternative to classical wrapped v-belts
  • More energy efficient than wrapped v-belts
  • Unique design for longer life
  • Less maintenance and downtime
  • EPDM rubber compound is static conductive, resistant to hardening and glazing, and operates in a broad temperature range (-50ºF to +250ºF)
  • Backed by our Iron Clad Guarantee
  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Shaker screens, debarkers, industrial washers and dryers, and more

Sizes

  • A, B and C cross-sections from 17" to 144"

Wedge-Band is the banded version of the hard-working Super Power-Wedge v-belt. Wedge-Band is an excellent choice for virtually any application where increased horsepower capacity and output is needed, or where conventional multiple belt drives are impractical because of space or weight limitations. The specially compounded wrapped construction is ideal for clutching operations. Banded v-belts are ideally suited for pulsating or heavily shock loaded drives and drives with extremely long center distances. Wedge-Band is oil and heat resistant, static dissipating, and it won’t turn over or jump off the drive.

Features/Advantages

  • Prevents belt whip and rollover on long center distance drives

  • Smoother clutching

  • Space and weight saver

  • Oversized polyester cord provides added belt strength and stability

  • Cord is chemically treated for resistance to belt stretch

  • Tie-band is highly engineered to permanently bond multiple belts together enabling the belts to function as a single unit with even load distribution and wear

  • Vibration is dampened

  • Heavy shock loads are absorbed

Applications

  • Mud pumps, rock crushers, stump grinders, and more

Sizes

  • R3V, R5V and R8V cross-sections from 34" to 601"

Round belts are a high performance solution for conveyors, quarter-turn, twisted, and serpentine drives. Our round belts feature a no-splice construction for added durability with minimal stretch for minimum take-up requirements.

The Problem Solver! Super II v-belts are the solution to the constant and costly problem of replacing ordinary v-belts on troublesome drives. Specially formulated fiber-loaded EPDM rubber compounds, engineered fabrics and high-modulus polyester cord offer greater strength, longer life, better heat dissipation and higher efficiencies than best-in-class wrapped v-belts. The raw edge construction results in more efficient power transmission and reduced energy loss.

More Grip. Less Slip. The Metric Power-Wedge Cog-Belt combines the advantages of the narrow wedge design with raw edge performance for maximum operating efficiency in a compact drive package. The narrow profile permits reduced drive widths and a smaller drive envelope. Higher horsepower ratings translate into greater design flexibility — reducing drive cost, space and weight.

The Power-Wedge Cog-Belt is now made of EPDM (Ethylene Propylene Diene Monomer), a synthetic rubber with outstanding properties. The raw-edge construction contributes to outstanding operating efficiency. More torque with little or no slippage. The result is savings — in time, in belt life and in energy costs.

Features/Advantages

  • High horsepower ratings

  • Design flexibility

  • Longer belt life

  • Durable                                                                         

  • Oil and heat resistant

  • Static conductive

  • Resists hardening and glazing

  • Broad operating temperature range (-50°F to +250°F)

  • Smoother running

  • Energy efficient

  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Drives that require metric cross sections on industrial machinery, fans, pumps, and more

Sizes

  • Available in SPZX, SPAX, SPBX, and SPCX cross sections from 643mm to 5092mm. Also available in 3VX, 5VX, and 8VX imperial sizes. Where applicable, belts are dual branded with imperial and metric part numbers.

The finest wrapped belt in the industry and workhorse of classical V-belts. Super Blue Ribbon v-belts assure dependable length stability and require less re-tensioning and take-up. The cord is coated with a special compound that produces a secure, long-lasting bond with the surrounding rubber. The heavy-duty fabric cover protects the core. Wedge-Band is the banded version of the hard-working Super Power-Wedge v-belt. Wedge-Band is an excellent choice for virtually any application where increased horsepower capacity and output is needed, or where conventional multiple belt drives are impractical because of space or weight limitations. The specially compounded wrapped construction is ideal for clutching operations. Banded v-belts are ideally suited for pulsating or heavily shock loaded drives and drives with extremely long center distances. Wedge-Band is oil and heat resistant, static dissipating, and it won’t turn over or jump off the drive.

Features/Advantages

  • Prevents belt whip and rollover on long center distance drives

  • Smoother clutching

  • Space and weight saver

  • Oversized polyester cord provides added belt strength and stability

  • Cord is chemically treated for resistance to belt stretch

  • Tie-band is highly engineered to permanently bond multiple belts together enabling the belts to function as a single unit with even load distribution and wear

  • Vibration is dampened

  • Heavy shock loads are absorbed

Applications

  • Mud pumps, rock crushers, stump grinders, and more

Sizes

  • R3V, R5V and R8V cross-sections from 34" to 601"

More Grip. Less Slip. The Metric Power-Wedge Cog-Belt combines the advantages of the narrow wedge design with raw edge performance for maximum operating efficiency in a compact drive package. The narrow profile permits reduced drive widths and a smaller drive envelope. Higher horsepower ratings translate into greater design flexibility — reducing drive cost, space and weight.

The Power-Wedge Cog-Belt is now made of EPDM (Ethylene Propylene Diene Monomer), a synthetic rubber with outstanding properties. The raw-edge construction contributes to outstanding operating efficiency. More torque with little or no slippage. The result is savings — in time, in belt life and in energy costs.

Features/Advantages

  • High horsepower ratings

  • Design flexibility

  • Longer belt life

  • Durable                                                                         

  • Oil and heat resistant

  • Static conductive

  • Resists hardening and glazing

  • Broad operating temperature range (-50°F to +250°F)

  • Smoother running

  • Energy efficient

  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Drives that require metric cross sections on industrial machinery, fans, pumps, and more

Sizes

  • Available in SPZX, SPAX, SPBX, and SPCX cross sections from 643mm to 5092mm. Also available in 3VX, 5VX, and 8VX imperial sizes. Where applicable, belts are dual branded with imperial and metric part numbers.

The original deep-groove notched design is specifically developed for double angle “CC” drives commonly found in the demanding textile industry. The deep groove prevents belt rollover while the notches provide added flexibility and longer life.

Features/Advantages

  • Multiple ply fabric cord provides superior strength and durability

  • Strong yet flexible for power transmission from both sides of the belt

  • Resistant to oil and heat

  • Static conductive

Applications

The Problem Solver! Super II v-belts are the solution to the constant and costly problem of replacing ordinary v-belts on troublesome drives. Specially formulated fiber-loaded EPDM rubber compounds, engineered fabrics and high-modulus polyester cord offer greater strength, longer life, better heat dissipation and higher efficiencies than best-in-class wrapped v-belts. The unique CNA (central neutral axis) cord placement positions the strength of the belt lower on the pulleys to maintain stability and prevent roll-over. The raw edge construction results in more efficient power transmission and reduced energy loss.

Features/Advantages

  • Higher performance alternative to classical wrapped v-belts
  • More energy efficient than wrapped v-belts
  • Unique design for longer life
  • Less maintenance and downtime
  • EPDM rubber compound is static conductive, resistant to hardening and glazing, and operates in a broad temperature range (-50ºF to +250ºF)
  • Backed by our Iron Clad Guarantee
  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Shaker screens, debarkers, industrial washers and dryers, and more

Sizes

  • A, B and C cross-sections from 17" to 144"

Round belts are a high performance solution for conveyors, quarter-turn, twisted, and serpentine drives. Our round belts feature a no-splice construction for added durability with minimal stretch for minimum take-up requirements.

Wedge-Band is the banded version of the hard-working Super Power-Wedge v-belt. Wedge-Band is an excellent choice for virtually any application where increased horsepower capacity and output is needed, or where conventional multiple belt drives are impractical because of space or weight limitations. The specially compounded wrapped construction is ideal for clutching operations. Banded v-belts are ideally suited for pulsating or heavily shock loaded drives and drives with extremely long center distances. Wedge-Band is oil and heat resistant, static dissipating, and it won’t turn over or jump off the drive.

Features/Advantages

  • Prevents belt whip and rollover on long center distance drives

  • Smoother clutching

  • Space and weight saver

  • Oversized polyester cord provides added belt strength and stability

  • Cord is chemically treated for resistance to belt stretch

  • Tie-band is highly engineered to permanently bond multiple belts together enabling the belts to function as a single unit with even load distribution and wear

  • Vibration is dampened

  • Heavy shock loads are absorbed

Applications

  • Mud pumps, rock crushers, stump grinders, and more

Sizes

  • R3V, R5V and R8V cross-sections from 34" to 601"

More Grip. Less Slip. The Metric Power-Wedge Cog-Belt combines the advantages of the narrow wedge design with raw edge performance for maximum operating efficiency in a compact drive package. The narrow profile permits reduced drive widths and a smaller drive envelope. Higher horsepower ratings translate into greater design flexibility — reducing drive cost, space and weight.

The Power-Wedge Cog-Belt is now made of EPDM (Ethylene Propylene Diene Monomer), a synthetic rubber with outstanding properties. The raw-edge construction contributes to outstanding operating efficiency. More torque with little or no slippage. The result is savings — in time, in belt life and in energy costs.

Features/Advantages

  • High horsepower ratings

  • Design flexibility

  • Longer belt life

  • Durable                                                                         

  • Oil and heat resistant

  • Static conductive

  • Resists hardening and glazing

  • Broad operating temperature range (-50°F to +250°F)

  • Smoother running

  • Energy efficient

  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Drives that require metric cross sections on industrial machinery, fans, pumps, and more

Sizes

  • Available in SPZX, SPAX, SPBX, and SPCX cross sections from 643mm to 5092mm. Also available in 3VX, 5VX, and 8VX imperial sizes. Where applicable, belts are dual branded with imperial and metric part numbers.

Wedge-Band is the banded version of the hard-working Super Power-Wedge v-belt. Wedge-Band is an excellent choice for virtually any application where increased horsepower capacity and output is needed, or where conventional multiple belt drives are impractical because of space or weight limitations. The specially compounded wrapped construction is ideal for clutching operations. Banded v-belts are ideally suited for pulsating or heavily shock loaded drives and drives with extremely long center distances. Wedge-Band is oil and heat resistant, static dissipating, and it won’t turn over or jump off the drive.

Features/Advantages

  • Prevents belt whip and rollover on long center distance drives

  • Smoother clutching

  • Space and weight saver

  • Oversized polyester cord provides added belt strength and stability

  • Cord is chemically treated for resistance to belt stretch

  • Tie-band is highly engineered to permanently bond multiple belts together enabling the belts to function as a single unit with even load distribution and wear

  • Vibration is dampened

  • Heavy shock loads are absorbed

Applications

  • Mud pumps, rock crushers, stump grinders, and more

Sizes

  • R3V, R5V and R8V cross-sections from 34" to 601"

Vee-Rib belts are ideally suited for high speed drives where conventional v-belts cannot operate. The Vee-Rib belt provides smooth, vibration-free performance in a compact drive. The special “truncated” rib design enhances belt flexibility and resists cracking better than non-truncated v-ribbed belts. Vee-Rib is resistant to oil, heat and abrasion for longer belt life.

Features/Advantages

  • Vibration-free

  • Heat resistant

  • Maximum flexibility

  • High horsepower

  • Abrasion resistant

Applications

  • Industrial dryers, fitness equipment, machine tools, high speed blowers, and more

Sizes

  • J cross-section from 13" to 98"

The Problem Solver! Super II v-belts are the solution to the constant and costly problem of replacing ordinary v-belts on troublesome drives. Specially formulated fiber-loaded EPDM rubber compounds, engineered fabrics and high-modulus polyester cord offer greater strength, longer life, better heat dissipation and higher efficiencies than best-in-class wrapped v-belts. The unique CNA (central neutral axis) cord placement positions the strength of the belt lower on the pulleys to maintain stability and prevent roll-over. The raw edge construction results in more efficient power transmission and reduced energy loss.

Features/Advantages

  • Higher performance alternative to classical wrapped v-belts
  • More energy efficient than wrapped v-belts
  • Unique design for longer life
  • Less maintenance and downtime
  • EPDM rubber compound is static conductive, resistant to hardening and glazing, and operates in a broad temperature range (-50ºF to +250ºF)
  • Backed by our Iron Clad Guarantee
  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Shaker screens, debarkers, industrial washers and dryers, and more

Sizes

  • A, B and C cross-sections from 17" to 144"

More Grip. Less Slip. The Metric Power-Wedge Cog-Belt combines the advantages of the narrow wedge design with raw edge performance for maximum operating efficiency in a compact drive package. The narrow profile permits reduced drive widths and a smaller drive envelope. Higher horsepower ratings translate into greater design flexibility — reducing drive cost, space and weight.

The Power-Wedge Cog-Belt is now made of EPDM (Ethylene Propylene Diene Monomer), a synthetic rubber with outstanding properties. The raw-edge construction contributes to outstanding operating efficiency. More torque with little or no slippage. The result is savings — in time, in belt life and in energy costs.

Features/Advantages

  • High horsepower ratings

  • Design flexibility

  • Longer belt life

  • Durable                                                                         

  • Oil and heat resistant

  • Static conductive

  • Resists hardening and glazing

  • Broad operating temperature range (-50°F to +250°F)

  • Smoother running

  • Energy efficient

  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Drives that require metric cross sections on industrial machinery, fans, pumps, and more

Sizes

  • Available in SPZX, SPAX, SPBX, and SPCX cross sections from 643mm to 5092mm. Also available in 3VX, 5VX, and 8VX imperial sizes. Where applicable, belts are dual branded with imperial and metric part numbers.

Round belts are a high performance solution for conveyors, quarter-turn, twisted, and serpentine drives. Our round belts feature a no-splice construction for added durability with minimal stretch for minimum take-up requirements.

Features/Advantages

  • Heavy duty stress-relieved fabric cover flexes better for improved belt life

  • Hi-modulus cords carry horsepower loads with minimum stretch

  • Better belt stability and fewer take-up adjustments

  • Compression section provides uniform cord support and improves belt flex life

  • No splice for added durability.

Applications

  • Conveyors, commercial sewing machines, quarter-turn drives, twisted drives, serpentine drives and more

Sizes

  • 7/16" and 9/16" diameters from 70" to 762"

The Problem Solver! Super II v-belts are the solution to the constant and costly problem of replacing ordinary v-belts on troublesome drives. Specially formulated fiber-loaded EPDM rubber compounds, engineered fabrics and high-modulus polyester cord offer greater strength, longer life, better heat dissipation and higher efficiencies than best-in-class wrapped v-belts. The unique CNA (central neutral axis) cord placement positions the strength of the belt lower on the pulleys to maintain stability and prevent roll-over. The raw edge construction results in more efficient power transmission and reduced energy loss.

Features/Advantages

  • Higher performance alternative to classical wrapped v-belts
  • More energy efficient than wrapped v-belts
  • Unique design for longer life
  • Less maintenance and downtime
  • EPDM rubber compound is static conductive, resistant to hardening and glazing, and operates in a broad temperature range (-50ºF to +250ºF)
  • Backed by our Iron Clad Guarantee
  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Shaker screens, debarkers, industrial washers and dryers, and more

Sizes

  • A, B and C cross-sections from 17" to 144"

The finest wrapped belt in the industry and workhorse of classical V-belts. Super Blue Ribbon v-belts assure dependable length stability and require less re-tensioning and take-up. The cord is coated with a special compound that produces a secure, long-lasting bond with the surrounding rubber. The heavy-duty fabric cover protects the core. Its extra flexibility permits the belt to bend more easily around the smallest pulleys with less strain on the fabric. Longer belt life results in less frequent replacement, less downtime and lower maintenance costs.

Wedge-Band is the banded version of the hard-working Super Power-Wedge v-belt. Wedge-Band is an excellent choice for virtually any application where increased horsepower capacity and output is needed, or where conventional multiple belt drives are impractical because of space or weight limitations. The specially compounded wrapped construction is ideal for clutching operations. Banded v-belts are ideally suited for pulsating or heavily shock loaded drives and drives with extremely long center distances. Wedge-Band is oil and heat resistant, static dissipating, and it won’t turn over or jump off the drive.

Features/Advantages

  • Prevents belt whip and rollover on long center distance drives

  • Smoother clutching

  • Space and weight saver

  • Oversized polyester cord provides added belt strength and stability

  • Cord is chemically treated for resistance to belt stretch

  • Tie-band is highly engineered to permanently bond multiple belts together enabling the belts to function as a single unit with even load distribution and wear

  • Vibration is dampened

  • Heavy shock loads are absorbed

Applications

  • Mud pumps, rock crushers, stump grinders, and more

Sizes

  • R3V, R5V and R8V cross-sections from 34" to 601"

More Grip. Less Slip. The Metric Power-Wedge Cog-Belt combines the advantages of the narrow wedge design with raw edge performance for maximum operating efficiency in a compact drive package. The narrow profile permits reduced drive widths and a smaller drive envelope. Higher horsepower ratings translate into greater design flexibility — reducing drive cost, space and weight.

The Power-Wedge Cog-Belt is now made of EPDM (Ethylene Propylene Diene Monomer), a synthetic rubber with outstanding properties. The raw-edge construction contributes to outstanding operating efficiency. More torque with little or no slippage. The result is savings — in time, in belt life and in energy costs.

Features/Advantages

  • High horsepower ratings

  • Design flexibility

  • Longer belt life

  • Durable                                                                         

  • Oil and heat resistant

  • Static conductive

  • Resists hardening and glazing

  • Broad operating temperature range (-50°F to +250°F)

  • Smoother running

  • Energy efficient

  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Drives that require metric cross sections on industrial machinery, fans, pumps, and more

Sizes

  • Available in SPZX, SPAX, SPBX, and SPCX cross sections from 643mm to 5092mm. Also available in 3VX, 5VX, and 8VX imperial sizes. Where applicable, belts are dual branded with imperial and metric part numbers.
