The original deep-groove notched design is specifically developed for double angle “CC” drives commonly found in the demanding textile industry. The deep groove prevents belt rollover while the notches provide added flexibility and longer life.

Features/Advantages

  • Multiple ply fabric cord provides superior strength and durability

  • Strong yet flexible for power transmission from both sides of the belt

  • Resistant to oil and heat

  • Static conductive

Applications

  • Drives with long center, serpentine applications usually found in the textile industry

NOTE: Dry Can belts are normally used as a single belt on a drive and matching is not required. When ordering two or more Dry Can belts to be used as a matched set on the same drive, please specify that the belts must be a matched set.

Sizes

  • Cross-section from 212" to 902"

More Grip. Less Slip. The Metric Power-Wedge Cog-Belt combines the advantages of the narrow wedge design with raw edge performance for maximum operating efficiency in a compact drive package. The narrow profile permits reduced drive widths and a smaller drive envelope. Higher horsepower ratings translate into greater design flexibility — reducing drive cost, space and weight.

The Power-Wedge Cog-Belt is now made of EPDM (Ethylene Propylene Diene Monomer), a synthetic rubber with outstanding properties. The raw-edge construction contributes to outstanding operating efficiency. More torque with little or no slippage. The result is savings — in time, in belt life and in energy costs.

Features/Advantages

  • High horsepower ratings

  • Design flexibility

  • Longer belt life

  • Durable                                                                         

  • Oil and heat resistant

  • Static conductive

  • Resists hardening and glazing

  • Broad operating temperature range (-50°F to +250°F)

  • Smoother running

  • Energy efficient

  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Drives that require metric cross sections on industrial machinery, fans, pumps, and more

Sizes

  • Available in SPZX, SPAX, SPBX, and SPCX cross sections from 643mm to 5092mm. Also available in 3VX, 5VX, and 8VX imperial sizes. Where applicable, belts are dual branded with imperial and metric part numbers.

Timken Belts is a leader in variable speed belt technology. For use with industrial variable speed pulleys to gain a wide range of driven speeds. Raw edge sidewalls improve gripping action. Unitized belt bonding and specially formulated rubber compounds provide superior resistance to aging caused by wear, oil, heat, and harmful environmental factors. The Variable Speed Cog-Belt has been engineered to the same high standards that Timken Belts uses to produce belts for original equipment manufacturers (OEMs).

Features/Advantages

  • Smooth running

  • Oil and heat resistant

  • Long belt life

  • Wide selection of sizes

  • Static dissipating

Applications

  • Industrial variable speed drives

  • For snowmobile and ATV variable speed belts click here

Sizes

  • A wide selection of cross sections, top widths and lengths

The Problem Solver! Super II v-belts are the solution to the constant and costly problem of replacing ordinary v-belts on troublesome drives. Specially formulated fiber-loaded EPDM rubber compounds, engineered fabrics and high-modulus polyester cord offer greater strength, longer life, better heat dissipation and higher efficiencies than best-in-class wrapped v-belts. The unique CNA (central neutral axis) cord placement positions the strength of the belt lower on the pulleys to maintain stability and prevent roll-over. The raw edge construction results in more efficient power transmission and reduced energy loss.

Features/Advantages

  • Higher performance alternative to classical wrapped v-belts
  • More energy efficient than wrapped v-belts
  • Unique design for longer life
  • Less maintenance and downtime
  • EPDM rubber compound is static conductive, resistant to hardening and glazing, and operates in a broad temperature range (-50ºF to +250ºF)
  • Backed by our Iron Clad Guarantee
  • Built to Chek Mate belt tolerances for a matched set

Applications

  • Shaker screens, debarkers, industrial washers and dryers, and more

Sizes

  • A, B and C cross-sections from 17" to 144"

Round belts are a high performance solution for conveyors, quarter-turn, twisted, and serpentine drives. Our round belts feature a no-splice construction for added durability with minimal stretch for minimum take-up requirements.

Features/Advantages

  • Heavy duty stress-relieved fabric cover flexes better for improved belt life

  • Hi-modulus cords carry horsepower loads with minimum stretch

  • Better belt stability and fewer take-up adjustments

  • Compression section provides uniform cord support and improves belt flex life

  • No splice for added durability.

Applications

  • Conveyors, commercial sewing machines, quarter-turn drives, twisted drives, serpentine drives and more

Sizes

  • 7/16" and 9/16" diameters from 70" to 762"
